programme.title: Matthias et Maxime
Matthias i Maxime
Matthias & Maxime
programme.desc: Matthias et Maxime: Directed by Xavier Dolan. With Gabriel D'Almeida Freitas, Xavier Dolan, Pier-Luc Funk, Samuel Gauthier. Hidden feelings come to light and threaten the bond of a group of friends in their late 20s." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8767908/","name":"Matthias et Maxime","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzAxODBiOGQtNjAwZi00ZTZlLTkwMjctODk4NmFkNGU3N2I1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA3MzQ4MTc0._V1_.jpg","description":"Hidden feelings come to light and threaten the bond of a group of friends in their late 20s.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8767908/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CinemaSerf"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Smoulders but lacks a spark.","reviewBody":"I was rather disappointed by this effort from Xavier Dolan. Perhaps writing/editting and starring in the film robbed him too much of objectivity when it came to actually watching this bit of a non-story. He portrays "Max", a young French-Canadian man who is about to emigrate to Australia. At a party with his childhood friends, he and handsome best pal Matt (Gabriel D'Almeida Freitas) get lumbered with starring in a video being made by one of their number's pesky younger sister. The scene involved the two of them kissing - something neither had done (as an adult) with a man before. What ensues is a slow, deliberately so, depiction of the complications that this kiss has on their relationship. "Matt" has a long term girlfriend, so his reconciliation with his "new" feelings for his friend take on a different guise from those of the single "Max" who has issues with his recovering addict mother. Sadly, though, too much of those repercussions are presumed on us by the director and not demonstrated to the audience. It doesn't need to be a cheesy traditional romance, nor a sex fest, but we are left to imagine or envisage that they want each other only because we know that's what the film is about - not because we are presented with much tangible, or even implied, sense of desire. Indeed the others in their group more readily flirt and banter than the two in the title. It doesn't have a beginning, middle and end - it just has a middle. A rather interestingly filmed and quite well put together middle, but a middle nonetheless. Certainly worth watching - I think Dolan has something about him - but I wanted more from the characters and the story - as it is I just felt like a rather unsatisfied observer.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6595,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2019-10-09","keywords":"gay character,friendship,kiss,in love with best friend,mother son relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OVS]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi707182105","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNjNTgxYjYtNzI1OS00MzUwLWE5MTEtMjJhZDZhMTllZDQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNjNTgxYjYtNzI1OS00MzUwLWE5MTEtMjJhZDZhMTllZDQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8570499/","name":"Gabriel D'Almeida Freitas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0230859/","name":"Xavier Dolan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2954178/","name":"Pier-Luc Funk"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0230859/","name":"Xavier Dolan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0489666/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0053578/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093053/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0230859/","name":"Xavier Dolan"}],"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Aktualności filmowe+
programme.desc: W cotygodniowym programie zostają przedstawione najbardziej interesujące wydarzenia ze świata kina. Pojawiają się wywiady z osobami związanymi z branżą filmową, prowadzone są rozmowy na temat premier, nowości muzycznych i teatralnych.

programme.title: Król: Prolog
programme.desc: O ośmioodcinkowym serialu "Król" porozmawiają jego twórcy - reżyser Jan P. Matuszyński, aktor Michał Żurawski oraz autor powieści będącej podstawą scenariusza, Szczepan Twardoch. Widzowie dowiedzą się m.in. kto jeszcze był brany pod uwagę do zagrania głównej roli i co było inspiracją dla pisarza przy tworzeniu książki. Twardoch opowie także o swoich wrażeniach z planu serialu, a reżyser zdradzi, jakie było największe wyzwanie podczas kręcenia zdjęć.

programme.title: Jak powstawał serial "Król"
programme.desc: Kulisy powstawania serialu "Król" w reżyserii Jana P. Matuszyńskiego. Produkcja stanowi ekranizację powieści Szczepana Twardocha o tym samym tytule.

Kiler
programme.desc: Kiler: Directed by Juliusz Machulski. With Cezary Pazura, Malgorzata Kozuchowska, Jerzy Stuhr, Janusz Rewinski. An innocent cab driver Jurek Kiler is mistaken for a contract killer and imprisoned. Soon, he is sprung by a mob boss who needs "Killer" for a few more jobs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0127626/","name":"Kiler","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDRkNWMxYWEtODUwMC00ZDRjLWI0MmQtMjFjNTFiMDYwZDZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjExODE1MDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"An innocent cab driver Jurek Kiler is mistaken for a contract killer and imprisoned. Jurek Kiler (see the prequel to this movie, "Kiler") has become a VIP - sponsoring the Polish government, playing tennis with the President, and stuff. He must oversee a transfer of a substantial amount of gold. However, in his past activities, he has made enemies. Mighty ones. programme.title: Night at the Museum: Secret of the Tomb
Noc w muzeum: Tajemnica grobowca
Night at the Museum: Secret of the Tomb
programme.desc:
Night at the Museum: Secret of the Tomb: Directed by Shawn Levy. With Ben Stiller, Robin Williams, Owen Wilson, Steve Coogan. Larry spans the globe, uniting favorite and new characters while embarking on an epic quest to save the magic before it is gone forever." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2692250/","name":"Night at the Museum: Secret of the Tomb","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1MzM2ODEyMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTIzODAwMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Larry spans the globe, uniting favorite and new characters while embarking on an epic quest to save the magic before it is gone forever.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2692250/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rgkarim"},"dateCreated":"2014-12-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Diluted Adventure, for Comedic Bluffs, Ending Wraps it up","reviewBody":"Another day, another sequel and this one is unfortunately another kids movie that shouldn't have seen the light of day. I'm not against sequels mind you, but in most kids series seldom is any sequel as good as the first installment. This is the case for this past weekend's release starring the ever wacky Ben Stiller and his posse of celebrities. Yes my friends we take another trip back to the museum, for another hopefully fun adventure amidst it's hallowed halls. So sit back and read a late review of another Night at the Museum, the Secret of the Tomb. 

Likes: One thing I have always liked with this series is the selection of exhibits they choose to bring to life, and the integration of their personalities. This installment brings the magic early on, bringing back familiar faces like Teddy (Robin Williams), Jed (Owen Wilson), and Octavius (Steve Coogan) in all their comedic glory. Amidst a grand speech, cool CGI effects are put into effect to bring the constellations alive that shine in all their cool blue light before chaos arises. Once we get to the London museum, more exciting things come alive, in the form of another CGI fossil, a mythical snake demon made of metal, and the warrior with golden locks Lancelot (Dan Stevens). The effects are fluid, the designs beautiful, and when actually integrated into the movie, more on that later, you get the fun feeling you got in the first movie. Unfortunately most of these objects are background, aimlessly wandering around the scene while the big boys come out to play. 

Outside of the special effects there are some fun pokes at human society's obsessions, especially at internet videos, pop culture, and of course ridiculous habits that celebrities have. Some of these jokes are well timed, often delivered in a manner that is quite funny. However, many of the jokes, as happens most of the time, lose their charm and the lack of any witty humor makes it pretty much just mindless rambling that kids will only enjoy. Oh sure it's cute, but Hollywood needs to learn that more isn't necessary funnier, in fact it's the opposite. However, audiences allow them to get away with it, so what is the use in complaining. 

Now past funny, this Night at the Museum has another emotional side to it, helping to teach the moral lesson of moving on in the magical theatrical way. With the use of orchestrated symphony work, well angled camera shots, decent writing, and of course great acting, I'll admit I got that tingly feeling all over. No it's not gas, but those looking for a life lesson reminder will get it in this film, and a decent closing to the series I think. As for acting, well Stiller gets the most screen time on this one. The verdict, it's alright when he's not acting like a buffoon, and the man has some surprising agility and giant snake battle skills. Most of the time he is a bumbling idiot, but given enough time he can pull out some other feelings that we saw in Meet the Parents. As for Williams, may he rest in peace, the man gave one brilliant performance despite his character being diluted from its previous glory. 

Dislikes: A lot in this category for this reviewer. It starts with the adventure, which in the third installment has been diluted to a rushed set of sequences, hastily edited together to get out in time for Christmas. A shame since the tale had promise of suspense, timing, and mystery that could have tied so many things together. Instead, the story lacked any depth, quickly revealing the secret without so much a trial, a challenge, or even an argument, it was just handed right to them and a rather lame story as well. In addition, a lot of the suspense was missing in this film, with only an irregular decay in the tablet's magic threatening our heroes. Speaking of which the cavalcade also lost their spunk, the strong willed character reduced to comedic boobs, some of which hardly utter a line, as Ben Stiller takes center stage. Such a shame indeed, but your kids will get a kick out of the simplistic journey, that is if they can sit in there seats which some chose not to. 

Instead the adventure was put aside for comedy, or what passed for it in this movie. Yes there were a few zingers at first, but they quickly were lost to stupid rants of ridiculous arguing with his caveman doppleganger, stupid exchange of words with exhibits, and some rather awkward discussions with Rebel Wilson. Sure it happens once or twice I can handle it, but it just kept happening, even at the big, exciting climax, with the lame bad guy. Why can these films not realize the limits of tired jokes? I can't answer it either, but sadly it took away from the movie. Perhaps this comedy was the reason why the characters were also a shell of their former glory, and why they were pretty much background characters with the new exhibits. Even the normally cute dynamic between father and son was bad, Hollywood choosing to make the son another lame teenager like most movies do. Is it accurate? Probably, but in a movie with magical tablets you would think a little magic could spread to the humans as well. 

I'm not going to lie, this movie failed me on many levels, and disappointed me for the grand conclusion. Still, it is a cute film that kids will handle, and still holds a little of the spark that got me into the series. Worth a trip to the theater? Not really, but if you wish to pay homage to a few of the stars I wouldn't blame you. My scores for this film are:

programme.title: Hotelowa Polska
programme.desc: Program pokazuje polskie hotele, które warto odwiedzić. Najdroższe nie zawsze jest najlepsze. Ta zasada sprawdza się też w kwestii noclegów. Prowadzący Damian Urbańczyk przybliża miejsca, które czarują gości niepowtarzalną atmosferą. Widzowie zwiedzają urocze pokoje, ekskluzywne restauracje oraz luksusowe salony spa, które gwarantują różne formy wypoczynku. Nie brakuje też oryginalnych pomysłów na podróże.

programme.title: Capital in the Twenty-First Century
Kapitał w XXI Wieku
Capital in the Twenty-First Century
programme.desc:
Capital in the Twenty-First Century: Directed by Justin Pemberton. With Michael Douglas, Vanessa Redgrave, Ronald Reagan, Daniel Huttlestone. Based on Thomas Piketty's No. 1 New York Times Bestseller, Capital in the Twenty-First Century explores one of the most important and controversial subjects of our time: wealth, and who gets a share of the dividends." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5723056/","name":"Capital in the Twenty-First Century","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2E5N2U2M2QtYTAzMi00M2U4LWJhY2YtMTIyMzY2ZmRmMjAzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjI3NDAyNg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Based on Thomas Piketty's No. 1 New York Times Bestseller, Capital in the Twenty-First Century explores one of the most important and controversial subjects of our time: wealth, and who gets a share of the dividends.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5723056/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"samyoung-82648"},"dateCreated":"2021-01-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good Content Sabotaged by Ideology","reviewBody":"There is a good documentary underneath the layers of ideology pushed in this documentary. The people who made this documentary humorously talk about equality whilst promoting identity politics. Further, this documentary suffers from people who don't know their history very well. I specifically do not put this onto the author of the book.

The documentary opens with slavery and tries to attribute all wealth of Europe and England to slavery. This doesn't work for countries like Germany and Switzerland (among others). Further, they purposely ignored slavery in Africa (by Africans) or slavery by the Arabs and why that was somehow different.

What the creators almost completely missed was the Industrial Revolution (it was touched on). The drive away from slavery had a significant impact on productivity and competition (but you have to know history to know that).

Then during the documentary, you have people like Kate William who (unbelievably) said we must remember the "working class and women". It's unclear if she meant "no woman must ever be poor" or if she was promoting the "Ophrah Winfrey is oppressed" angle. With an ideologist (more specifically, a sexist), reason is always missing.

The documentary also touched on how noble China was, ignoring how people were welded into their houses, how Hong Kong was destroyed, or how the Uyghurs are interned in concentration camps. This isn't to side-step the criticisms of the west (which are predominantly spelled out in this documentary - and quite fairly might I add). It's unclear what the motive of this false narrative was.

Then there's the jaw-dropping narcissism of Faiza Shaheen who unbelievably said "why does my 26yo brother in law have to live at home". My parents lived in a garage for 10 years! I lived in shabby accommodation for 10 years - but Ms Shaheen believes she is special! The narcissim was unbeliebable.

Then there's the "all white people are racist narrative". In recent months, AOC and Nancy Pelosi and Jo BIden who continually disparage all white people with the "white supremacy" pejorative that the documentary "glossed over". Instead, they went for the "we are all equal (some more than others)" narrative.

Rather than glorifying Margaret Thatcher in a "girl power" narrative, they could have talked how she destroyed working class Brits and incited significant levels of violence whilst destroying people's lives, especially as that was a theme of the documentary. Sadly, such analysis would never have been permitted when the documentary was heavily influenced by ideology.

If you can make it past the indoctrination and the "you shouldn't think for yourself", there is an excellent message about tax havens, inheritance, concentrations of wealth and the failure of trickle down economics.

My honest advice is the director and several of the guest speakers were unfit to be involved in a documentary and the documentary suffered for it. The message was clear... all people are equal but some are more equal than others. A message sung loudly by Kate William and Ms Shaheen

I'm being kind and giving it 6/10 because the underlying message (under the ideology) was solid.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2521,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"genre":["Documentary"],"datePublished":"2019-10-10","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Capital in the Twenty-First Century","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi363118105","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTlhYTJhZmYtMzM0Zi00ZWNhLWI0YzEtMTA4OWFiNjY5YmRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTlhYTJhZmYtMzM0Zi00ZWNhLWI0YzEtMTA4OWFiNjY5YmRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 1"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000140/","name":"Michael Douglas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000603/","name":"Vanessa Redgrave"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001654/","name":"Ronald Reagan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1703633/","name":"Justin Pemberton"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0181221/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0742396/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3843888/","name":"Thomas Piketty"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1703633/","name":"Justin Pemberton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1195574/","name":"Matthew Metcalfe"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

If you can make it past the indoctrination and the "you shouldn't think for yourself", there is an excellent message about tax havens, inheritance, concentrations of wealth and the failure of trickle down economics.

My honest advice is the director and several of the guest speakers were unfit to be involved in a documentary and the documentary suffered for it. The message was clear... all people are equal but some are more equal than others. A message sung loudly by Kate William and Ms Shaheen

I'm being kind and giving it 6/10 because the underlying message (under the ideology) was solid.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2521,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5,"genre":["Documentary"],"datePublished":"2019-10-10","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Capital in the Twenty-First Century","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi363118105","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTlhYTJhZmYtMzM0Zi00ZWNhLWI0YzEtMTA4OWFiNjY5YmRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTlhYTJhZmYtMzM0Zi00ZWNhLWI0YzEtMTA4OWFiNjY5YmRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 1","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000140/","name":"Michael Douglas","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000603/","name":"Vanessa Redgrave","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001654/","name":"Ronald Reagan"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1703633/","name":"Justin Pemberton"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0181221/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0742396/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3843888/","name":"Thomas Piketty","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1703633/","name":"Justin Pemberton","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1195574/","name":"Matthew Metcalfe"],"duration":"PT1H43M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Kiss of Death
Pocałunek śmierci
Kiss of Death
programme.desc:
Kiss of Death: Directed by Barbet Schroeder. With David Caruso, Samuel L. Jackson, Nicolas Cage, Helen Hunt. A reformed convict goes undercover with the help of an angry detective to ensnare a psychotic mobster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0113552/","name":"Kiss of Death","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmMwNmVkZDItY2UzNi00ZGE2LTlkOTUtNDNlOGJkZDNhYjVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDAxNjkxNjQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A reformed convict goes undercover with the help of an angry detective to ensnare a psychotic mobster.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0113552/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ccthemovieman-1"},"dateCreated":"2006-04-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Okay, But Just Too Hard, Too Nasty For Most People","reviewBody":"This is not the 1947 film but a 1995 re-make of the famous gangster flick of the same name. While the classic film had one brutally nasty guy, this one has a whole cast full of them....too nasty, frankly. I watched this once and was fairly interested in it. A couple of years later, took a second look and found it so sleazy and I couldn't finish it.

David Caruso, who obtained a lot more fame in television shows than movies, still was interesting for me to watch as he played Victor Mature's old role. Caruso is one of the better actors I've seen when it comes to expressing his emotions just by his facial looks. It seems fashionable to knock him, but I've always been a fan of his work.

Nicholas Cage plays Richard Widmark's psycho character "Tommy Udo" but is called "Little Junior Brown" in this film. Personally, I liked Widmark's performance and character much more.

A lot of people, especially 20-somethings, like these modern tough films with brutal characters and tons of profanity, but the characters in this movie were so nasty that the film never really caught on with anybody. 

It certainly had one thing going for it: a very good cast that also included Samuel L. Jackson, Michael Rapaport, Ving Rhames, Stanley Tuccki, Helen Hunt and Kathryn Erbe.

To summarize: it's not that bad: it just has too hard an edge to it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18787,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1995-04-21","keywords":"neo noir,witness protection,cocaine,undercover,tears","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Kiss of Death","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi313131289","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGRjZjA2NTItYzZiMi00MmZkLThiNDAtMjMyYTVlNmVmYzAxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGRjZjA2NTItYzZiMi00MmZkLThiNDAtMjMyYTVlNmVmYzAxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000325/","name":"David Caruso"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000168/","name":"Samuel L. Jackson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000115/","name":"Nicolas Cage"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0775447/","name":"Barbet Schroeder"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0513787/","name":"Eleazar Lipsky"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0372942/","name":"Ben Hecht"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0496468/","name":"Charles Lederer"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

While the classic film had one brutally nasty guy, this one has a whole cast full of them....too nasty, frankly. I watched this once and was fairly interested in it. A couple of years later, took a second look and found it so sleazy and I couldn't finish it.

David Caruso, who obtained a lot more fame in television shows than movies, still was interesting for me to watch as he played Victor Mature's old role. programme.title: 365 obiadów Mariety Mareckiej
programme.desc: Gospodyni programu podpowiada, skąd czerpać inspiracje na codzienne obiady. Marieta Marecka zaprezentuje szereg prostych posiłków. W każdym odcinku zaprezentuje trzy nowe, często zaskakujące potrawy.

credits.actor: Anna Valle, Loretta Goggi, Ana Caterina Morariu, Giorgio Marchesi, Irene Ferri, Alessio Vassallo, Leonardo Della Bianca, Aurora Giovinazzo, Niccolò Calvagna

programme.title: News+
programme.desc: Podsumowanie najważniejszych wydarzeń z aren sportowych. Omówienie sukcesów, rekordów i porażek. Program prowadzą zamiennie m.in. Piotr Karpiński, Piotr Salak, Wojciech Zawioła i Gabriel Rogaczewski.

programme.title: Wysoki Pressing
programme.desc: Prowadzony w lekkiej formule telewizji śniadaniowej program poświęcony piłce nożnej. Gospodarz wraz z gośćmi omówi najważniejsze boiskowe wydarzenia, nie zabraknie też wnikliwych analiz i gorących dyskusji. Prowadzącymi na zmianę będą Daria Kabała-Malarz i Michał Kołodziejczyk.

programme.title: Turbokozak Extra
programme.desc: Bartosz Ignacik i Grzegorz Jędrzejewski sprawdzają, jak ludzie związani z szeroko pojętym światem sportu poradzą sobie na boisku. Zaproszeni goście muszą wykonać różne piłkarskie zadania. Za ich wykonanie otrzymują punkty, które zaliczane są do klasyfikacji danego sezonu programu.

programme.title: O co biega?
programme.desc: W magazynie nowinki oraz praktyczne porady dla osób, które uprawiają bieganie rekreacyjnie, półprofesjonalnie, zawodowo lub dopiero zaczynają. Gospodarz programu Marcin Rosłoń wraz z ekspertami będzie podpowiadał, jak przygotować się do biegania amatorskiego i zawodowego, jak dobrać odpowiedni sprzęt lub przygotować się do maratonu. W programie nie zabraknie również ciekawostek, rozmów ze sportowcami i osobami z show-biznesu, które opowiedzą o swojej pasji do biegania.

programme.title: Turbokozak
programme.desc: Bartosz Ignacik i Grzegorz Jędrzejewski w zabawnym teście sprawdzają umiejętności piłkarskie zawodników z Ekstraklasy. Czasem w programie pojawiają się reprezentanci innych dyscyplin i znane osoby.

credits.actor: Karolina Kuszewska-Łukasik, Sasha Sidorenko, Sylwia Zaczkiewicz, Dominika Rembelska, Gabriela Kuzawińska, Ewa Piątkowska, Joanna Jędrzejczyk, Sylwia Kusiak, Magdalena Loska

programme.title: Zielona rewolucja Marty Dymek

programme.title: Bitwa na smaki: David vs Matteo 3

programme.title: Nieznany Madagaskar
programme.desc: Niepowtarzalna przyroda Madagaskaru znajduje się w niebezpieczeństwie. Wyspa, która leży na Oceanie Indyjskim, przy wschodnim wybrzeżu Afryki, fascynuje nie tylko bogactwem flory, ale też niezwykłymi endemicznymi gatunkami zwierząt. Niestety, okazuje się, że nie ma ona nic wspólnego z rajem. Autorzy dwuczęściowego dokumentu pokazują, jak szybko człowiek ze swoją gospodarką doprowadza do zniszczenia tamtejszej przyrody, m.in. sporych połaci lasów deszczowych.

programme.title: The Prince of Egypt
Książę Egiptu
The Prince of Egypt
programme.desc: The Prince of Egypt: Directed by Brenda Chapman, Steve Hickner, Simon Wells. With Val Kilmer, Ralph Fiennes, Michelle Pfeiffer, Sandra Bullock. Egyptian Prince Moses learns of his identity as a Hebrew and his destiny to become the chosen deliverer of his people." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120794/","name":"The Prince of Egypt","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWNjMjgyNmMtNWMzZC00YjI4LWI1NmUtMTY0ZTA0ZDQ4Y2EwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTUyMzE4Mzg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Egyptian Prince Moses learns of his identity as a Hebrew and his destiny to become the chosen deliverer of his people.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120794/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dilipbts"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"The prince of Egypt","reviewBody":"For sheer spectacle, it's tough to beat the Bible. With "The Prince of Egypt," DreamWorks makes good on its promise to deliver a state-of-the-art animated film that will compete favorably with the best Disney has to offer. As with "Antz," released earlier this year, DreamWorks has successfully resisted the temptation to populate this film with characters that can be turned into further revenue through toy sales. (I do wonder, though, if three soundtrack albums--the film's soundtrack, an "inspirational" album, and a "country" album--were really necessary.) The animation team has accomplished something truly spectacular; watching "The Prince of Egypt" is like seeing life breathed into a rich, luxurious tapestry. The Biblical story told in the books of Genesis and Exodus is followed very faithfully, with only minor changes made for dramatic reasons. The action sequences are truly exciting, overall pacing is excellent, and the miracles wrought by God are depicted with awed and respectful wonder. One truly astonishing, harrowing sequence recounts the slaughter of firstborn Hebrew children by bringing hieroglyphic drawings to life on the walls of an Egyptian temple. The voice work is especially good--Val Kilmer is fine as Moses, and Pharoah, voiced by Ralph Fiennes, positively seethes with arrogance and hubris. The storytellers wisely chose to end their tale at the climactic crossing of the Red Sea; even the delivery of the Ten Commandments is portrayed only in an epilogue vignette. (After all, the Israelites wander in the wilderness for forty years after that, and Moses ultimately is not allowed to enter the Promised Land--perhaps not the uplifting ending the filmmakers had in mind.) Some of the subject matter is dark and disturbing, and there is no shying away from the harsh realities of the original texts. By all means, see it with the children in your life--and be prepared to discuss it with them afterward.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":125732,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"(Banned)","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"1998-12-16","keywords":"hebrew,ancient egypt,miracle,brother versus brother,bible story","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Prince of Egypt","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2683437337","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODBlYzFhNzMtNWM2My00MmRhLTkxOTgtODdjMWM2OWMyZGJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODBlYzFhNzMtNWM2My00MmRhLTkxOTgtODdjMWM2OWMyZGJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Dreamworks Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000174/","name":"Val Kilmer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000146/","name":"Ralph Fiennes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000201/","name":"Michelle Pfeiffer"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0152312/","name":"Brenda Chapman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9054338/","name":"Steve Hickner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0920425/","name":"Simon Wells"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129164/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0493857/","name":"Philip LaZebnik"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0583292/","name":"Nicholas Meyer"}],"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: All My Life
All My Life
programme.desc: All My Life: Directed by Marc Meyers. With Jessica Rothe, Harry Shum Jr., Marielle Scott, Chrissie Fit. A couple's wedding plans are thrown off course when the groom is diagnosed with liver cancer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8305852/","name":"All My Life","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGJiMzBlY2ItZTRjNS00OWFiLWI4YmUtZjVlMmY4OWFhMTIxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A couple's wedding plans are thrown off course when the groom is diagnosed with liver cancer.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8305852/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"LiveLoveLead"},"dateCreated":"2021-08-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Based on a true story, makes it more endearing!","reviewBody":"Based on a true story (they show the actual couple at the end), this movie takes you on a roller coaster ride of emotions, happy tears and smiles for the sweet romantic parts and sad tears for the heartbreaking parts. It's not the most original or best film out there, but it was a romantic and beautiful story that was very delightful to watch. The characters were charming, the acting was decent, the music was fun, and the message was meaningful. It might be a little to cute/sappy/chick flick for some, but it is an enjoyable and touching film IMHO! Aug2021.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3112,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-12-04","keywords":"wedding,three word title,terminal illness,cancer,liver cancer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3348087065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTY5MmI2ODItMGNhZS00MjQzLTgwYTEtMGViNjZkMDA4NzA0XkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTY5MmI2ODItMGNhZS00MjQzLTgwYTEtMGViNjZkMDA4NzA0XkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg","description":"Based on the powerful true love story that inspired an entire nation, All My Life follows the journey of an engaged couple who make the difficult decision to accelerate their wedding in the wake of a devastating discovery."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1557329/","name":"Jessica Rothe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1484270/","name":"Harry Shum Jr."},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2900746/","name":"Marielle Scott"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1836315/","name":"Marc Meyers"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0163543/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0739708/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1565798/","name":"Todd Rosenberg"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hollywood Buzz
programme.desc: W programie nowości kinowe, relacje z planów zdjęciowych oraz ciekawostki związanych z gwiazdami srebrnego ekranu. O pracy nad najnowszymi hollywoodzkimi produkcjami opowiadają ich twórcy - znani reżyserzy i aktorzy. Autorzy magazynu przedstawiają również zwiastuny filmów wchodzących na ekrany kin.

programme.title: Driven
Desperat

programme.desc: Dobroduszny, ale samotny Richard (Oscar Isaac) zostaje dyrektorem więzienia. Teraz musi przeglądać całą korespondencję osadzonych. Postanawia podjąć działania, które wydają mu się słuszne.

programme.title: Body Brokers
Straceńcy
Body Brokers
programme.desc: Body Brokers: Directed by John Swab. With Suzanne Wind, Frank Grillo, Alice Englert, Samone James. Brought to Los Angeles for treatment, a recovering junkie soon learns that the rehab center is not about helping people, but a cover for a multi-billion-dollar fraud operation that enlists addicts to recruit other addicts." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9585676/","name":"Body Brokers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmYzMjQ4ZTAtMjI0OC00ZDhiLWJkMzctMDgxYTI2ZDRiYTg0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Brought to Los Angeles for treatment, a recovering junkie soon learns that the rehab center is not about helping people, but a cover for a multi-billion-dollar fraud operation that enlists addicts to recruit other addicts.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9585676/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Xavier_Stone"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"A unique tale, a bit overdone and barely alright","reviewBody":"The start and setup of this movie is decent and it tells an interesting story. However the financials are way out of whack and ruins any true insight. The wandering path is done adequately enough but it feels half finished and leaves an unsatisfied feeling at the completion. Maybe it's just me, but if you're going to make a movie about preaching the dangers of drugs and wanting people to change I think you need to put an effort into making a good film. Otherwise it's easily forgotten 5 minutes after watching it, like this one is.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2213,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2021-02-19","keywords":"los angeles california,drug addiction,addiction,fraud,reference to the affordable care act","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2724708633","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTVjODUwYjktOTM3OC00OGZhLWI0MGYtOWU4ODFkNTFkMDk4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTVjODUwYjktOTM3OC00OGZhLWI0MGYtOWU4ODFkNTFkMDk4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Utah and Opal are junkies living on the streets of rural Ohio until a seemingly chance encounter with the enigmatic Wood (Michael Kenneth Williams) brings them to Los Angeles for treatment. While Utah finds sobriety with the help of the treatment center shrink (Academy Award®-Winner Melissa Leo), he soon learns that rehab is not about helping people--it's merely a cover scheme for a multibillion dollar fraud operation, enlisting addicts to recruit other addicts. Seduced by the money, but troubled by the hypocrisy, Utah must decide between what will make him rich, and what will save Opal."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm12333318/","name":"Suzanne Wind"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0342029/","name":"Frank Grillo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2129444/","name":"Alice Englert"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6461537/","name":"John Swab"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0320829/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0586673/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0474730/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6461537/","name":"John Swab"}],"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

Z odzysku
programme.desc: Z odzysku: Directed by Slawomir Fabicki. With Antoni Pawlicki, Nataliya Vdovina, Jacek Braciak, Dimitri Melnichuk. 19 year old Wojtek lives in a poverty stricken Polish town. He is in love with an older woman, an illegal emigrant from Ukraine. He boxes in illegal matches to get money and is spotted by a man running a security business. Accepting this man's offer means becoming a gangster, but this could allow him to a residence permit for his girlfriend Katya." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0800275/","name":"Z odzysku","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDAwYmI3NGMtZTJhOS00NDQ4LWIwN2EtZjFmYjA4ODQ0MDg4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"19 year old Wojtek lives in a poverty stricken Polish town. programme.title: The Scheme
The Crew
programme.desc:
The Scheme: Directed by Pat Kondelis. With Christian Dawkins, Sean Miller, Will Wade. The true story of basketball insider Christian Dawkins, who hustled the FBI in a scandal that threatened to take down the NCAA." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11916278/","name":"The Scheme","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGRmOGI1NGQtMmI2Ny00YjQ2LTg5YTgtYTU2ZTY5MDY4MTgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The true story of basketball insider Christian Dawkins, who hustled the FBI in a scandal that threatened to take down the NCAA.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11916278/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"philip-00197"},"dateCreated":"2020-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Misdirected bias.","reviewBody":"The Scheme appears to lack just that. It's hard to determine what Kondelis is trying to achieve with this: The inefficiency of law enforcement? The corruption of sport? The, relative innocence of Christian Dawkins?

Despite not focusing on any given topic, the overall sensation is that The Scheme is lacking in a prerequisite for documentaries - objectivity.

Why take the viewpoint that Dawkins, who is obviously knee deep in a crooked system, should be the chosen voice to criticise said system?

There is an element of truth in the fact that he got hard done by in relation to his involvement - but a nuance of raw deal hardly makes for a great documentary.

If you're looking to criticise the system - do so. If you're using Dawkins to demonstrate a miscarriage of justice - there are thousands more deserving.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":784,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Documentary","Crime"],"datePublished":"2020-03-31","keywords":"ncaa,professional basketball,hustler,bribery,fbi investigation","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11465806/","name":"Christian Dawkins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11465807/","name":"Sean Miller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11465808/","name":"Will Wade"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2897692/","name":"Pat Kondelis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0462903/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008693/"}],"duration":"PT1H58M"}</script><metacontent="

Le prince oublié: Directed by Michel Hazanavicius. With Omar Sy, Bérénice Bejo, François Damiens, Sarah Gaye. Every night as Sofia falls asleep, her father Djibi takes her into "Storyland", a fantasy film studio where their extraordinary fairy-tale adventures come to life starring Djibi in the lead role as the heroic Prince Charming." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8335482/","name":"Le prince oublié","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTJiZWEyNDMtNWNjOC00ZGJhLWExZjYtOTRhZmNlNjg0YzEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA3MzQ4MTc0._V1_.jpg","description":"Every night as Sofia falls asleep, her father Djibi takes her into "Storyland", a fantasy film studio where their extraordinary fairy-tale adventures come to life starring Djibi in the lead role as the heroic Prince Charming.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8335482/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"isaacochoterena"},"dateCreated":"2021-10-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Entertaining but with rare moments","reviewBody":"In this film the plot is well constructed, although the ending is unsatisfactory.

The theme of growing up, maturing and how parents perceive it in their children is exposed. There are very good things like some special effects, how the story tells and how the brain perceives the phenomenon of growing up. Although there are times when it looks a bit like Inside Out and Toy Story, the ending feels empty and the closing is unsatisfactory.

It is a movie with a good message about growing up and with a good story to tell, but the ending ruins what was previously built.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1149,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2020-02-12","keywords":"night","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [English SUB]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3936402969","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzM5ZGU3M2QtMjMyYS00NDJlLTgyZGUtN2I4NmMxYjliYmYwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzM5ZGU3M2QtMjMyYS00NDJlLTgyZGUtN2I4NmMxYjliYmYwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1082477/","name":"Omar Sy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0067367/","name":"Bérénice Bejo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1460782/","name":"François Damiens"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0371890/","name":"Michel Hazanavicius"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0775436/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022869/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1315212/","name":"Bruno Merle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4380548/","name":"Noé Debré"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0371890/","name":"Michel Hazanavicius"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Aktualności filmowe+
programme.desc: W cotygodniowym programie zostają przedstawione najbardziej interesujące wydarzenia ze świata kina. Pojawiają się wywiady z osobami związanymi z branżą filmową, prowadzone są rozmowy na temat premier, nowości muzycznych i teatralnych.

credits.actor: Federico Ielapi, Roberto Benigni, Rocco Papaleo, Massimo Ceccherini, Marine Vacth, Gigi Proietti, Alida Baldari Calabria, Alessio Di Domenicantonio, Maria Pia Timo

programme.title: Amazon, ufam Tobie
programme.desc: Amazon to amerykańskie przedsiębiorstwo handlowe, które jest jedną z najpotężniejszych korporacji na świecie. Istnieje na rynku od lat 90., najpierw jako księgarnia internetowa, dzisiaj jako międzynarodowy technologiczny gigant. Oprócz sprzedaży, zajmuje się m.in. produkcją własnych pozycji filmowych. Twórcy dokumentu szukają odpowiedzi na pytanie, jaki jest wpływ Amazona na nasze życie, kulturę, prawo oraz etykę pracy.

programme.title: Nie ten czlowiek
Nie ten człowiek
programme.desc: Nie ten czlowiek: Directed by Pawel Wendorff. With Bartosz Turzynski, Slawomir Orzechowski, Jan Frycz, Jacek Braciak. The film is a surreal collage of interrelated threads revolving around history of thirty-year-old Kuba who, with his parents' encouragement, decides to take his first job. Though none too convinced, he starts work as a delivery man. Having set out on his first delivery soon after he witnesses a traffic accident. He ends up giving a statement at the police station. And his plans begin to unravel. By a twist of fate Kuba has no idea about the significance of the part he will have to play on this particular day." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1808335/","name":"Nie ten czlowiek","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDkzODc4ZGUtNGYzZi00YzdmLWJkMWMtZDE5YzYxNThiNDJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The film is a surreal collage of interrelated threads revolving around history of thirty-year-old Kuba who, with his parents' encouragement, decides to take his first job. programme.title: Lincoln
Lincoln
programme.desc:
Lincoln: Directed by Steven Spielberg. With Daniel Day-Lewis, Sally Field, David Strathairn, Joseph Gordon-Levitt. As the American Civil War continues to rage, America's president struggles with continuing carnage on the battlefield as he fights with many inside his own cabinet on the decision to emancipate the slaves." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0443272/","name":"Lincoln","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQzNzczMDUyNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjM2ODEzOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"As the American Civil War continues to rage, America's president struggles with continuing carnage on the battlefield as he fights with many inside his own cabinet on the decision to emancipate the slaves.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0443272/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"StevePulaski"},"dateCreated":"2012-11-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"A capsule of a great president and a director's increasing maturity","reviewBody":"Daniel Day-Lewis is something of an unsung miracle; the man will come out of nowhere, select an unlikely role, knock it out of the park, then quietly crawl back into the ground for the next three or four years before repeating the same process. He is an underrated talent most likely due to his lack of a prolific career, somewhat like director Terrence Malick. Here, Day-Lewis teams up with one of Hollywood's most prolific men, Steven Spielberg, who is coming off a stellar 2011, where he produced both Super 8 and Transformers: Dark of the Moon and directed both The Adventures of Tintin and War Horse, two acclaimed pictures.

Spielberg mans the camera in one of the most exhilarating biopics in recent memory. Lincoln is a stunning humanization and coloring-book job of American politics, shedding a light on the skepticism and grayness of the government during that time. To simplify the story, Spielberg chooses to focus on the political interworkings of our sixteenth president's cabinet rather than the Civil War itself. It shows the long, grating process of amending the United States' constitution for the thirteenth time to abolish slavery and grant African Americans equality, and how that more than one men stood at the center of the action when the process was taking place, along with how he was incorruptibly confident that ending the practice of slavery will lead to ending the war.

While titled "Lincoln," we get several other characters with a fairly surprising amount of screen time. Among them are Joseph Gordon-Levitt playing Lincoln's oldest son, Robert Todd, Tommy Lee Jones playing Thaddeus Stevens, the fiery Radical Republican leader who is strongly passionate about abolitionism, Sally Field as the president's devoted wife, Mary Todd, and David Strathairn as William Seward, the secretary of state. It could also be said that at times Abraham Lincoln is not writer Tony Kushner's (who also penned Spielberg's Munich, unseen by me) prime focus, as much as it is the backroom deals of the 1865 congress and the political battles and obstacles each member faced when their morals and ideology came forth in abolishing one of the most inhumane acts ever allowed in the United States.

Daniel Day-Lewis is mesmerizing here, never overplaying or shortchanging Lincoln in one of his most reliable roles yet. Here, he seems much more cinematic than his previous works, and seems to be smitten with Lincoln's character and persona as he embodies him for one-hundred and fifty minutes. His voice is not stereotypically deep manly, and guttural as many other works have made him out to be, but reedy and poetically satisfying, boasting not much more than historical records claim. Day-Lewis is only assisted by the wealth of invaluable talent he is surrounded by, yet some of the most powerful work of his career comes out when Lincoln is reciting stories or parables to a group of bewildered, yet fascinated individuals who recall and cherish every word the man is saying.

One requirement upon seeing Lincoln is you must commit to two and a half hours of dialog and monologues from several characters about several different topics. One challenge faced by the filmmakers that is inherently difficult to overcome is the wealth of information, history, and knowledge of the period, and we see the struggle they face at attempting to sum it all up into a structured, disciplined film. I could've seen this as an HBO ten to fifteen part miniseries, elaborating on smaller characters, extending the work of the amendment, and even showing Lincoln's impact on a still vulnerable United States. But such an action may have proved too heavy for even history buffs.

With this film, there is a lot going on in terms of subtleties and there is a plethora of weight that rests on the film's script that at times makes this a challenging picture to watch. I'm reminded of my recent adventure to see the Wachowski's Cloud Atlas, and how that film was beautiful, striking, and increasingly ambitious, but also maddening and occasionally tedious. I wouldn't so much call Lincoln maddening or tedious as I would challenging to stay in-tuned with.

But that does not mean I couldn't see thousands of people emerging pleased and delighted with the film they just saw. This is a richly detailed and unsurprisingly intellectual picture that will go down as one of the greatest cinematic endeavors to ever focus on American politics. Kushner and Spielberg have gone on to make quite possibly the best film we'll ever see about the passage of an amendment through congress and the exhausting compromises and deals that go along with the process. Finally, I must note Spielberg's top notch use of subversive elements from Lincoln's voice, to the focus of the picture from a narrative point of view, to the inevitable conclusion that still leaves us impacted and shaken.

Starring: Daniel Day-Lewis, Sally Field, David Strathairn, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, James Spader, Hal Holbrook, Tommy Lee Jones, and Jackie Earle Haley. Directed by: Steven Spielberg.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":253482,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2013-02-20","keywords":"based on real person,1860s,american civil war,politics,cultural conflict","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Winner: Best Actor","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi759866393","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2MzYzOTY4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDE5OTA3OA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2MzYzOTY4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDE5OTA3OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"As the Civil War continues to rage, America's president struggles with continuing carnage on the battlefield and as he fights with many inside his own cabinet on the decision to emancipate the slaves."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000358/","name":"Daniel Day-Lewis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000398/","name":"Sally Field"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000657/","name":"David Strathairn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000229/","name":"Steven Spielberg"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0336601/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1065785/","name":"Tony Kushner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0329447/","name":"Doris Kearns Goodwin"}],"duration":"PT2H30M"}</script><metacontent="

Here, he seems much more cinematic than his previous works, and seems to be smitten with Lincoln's character and persona as he embodies him for one-hundred and fifty minutes. His voice is not stereotypically deep manly, and guttural as many other works have made him out to be, but reedy and poetically satisfying, boasting not much more than historical records claim. Day-Lewis is only assisted by the wealth of invaluable talent he is surrounded by, yet some of the most powerful work of his career comes out when Lincoln is reciting stories or parables to a group of bewildered, yet fascinated individuals who recall and cherish every word the man is saying.

One requirement upon seeing Lincoln is you must commit to two and a half hours of dialog and monologues from several characters about several different topics. One challenge faced by the filmmakers that is inherently difficult to overcome is the wealth of information, history, and knowledge of the period, and we see the struggle they face at attempting to sum it all up into a structured, disciplined film. I could've seen this as an HBO ten to fifteen part miniseries, elaborating on smaller characters, extending the work of the amendment, and even showing Lincoln's impact on a still vulnerable United States. But such an action may have proved too heavy for even history buffs.

With this film, there is a lot going on in terms of subtleties and there is a plethora of weight that rests on the film's script that at times makes this a challenging picture to watch. I'm reminded of my recent adventure to see the Wachowski's Cloud Atlas, and how that film was beautiful, striking, and increasingly ambitious, but also maddening and occasionally tedious. I wouldn't so much call Lincoln maddening or tedious as I would challenging to stay in-tuned with.

But that does not mean I couldn't see thousands of people emerging pleased and delighted with the film they just saw. This is a richly detailed and unsurprisingly intellectual picture that will go down as one of the greatest cinematic endeavors to ever focus on American politics. Kushner and Spielberg have gone on to make quite possibly the best film we'll ever see about the passage of an amendment through congress and the exhausting compromises and deals that go along with the process. Finally, I must note Spielberg's top notch use of subversive elements from Lincoln's voice, to the focus of the picture from a narrative point of view, to the inevitable conclusion that still leaves us impacted and shaken.

Starring: Daniel Day-Lewis, Sally Field, David Strathairn, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, James Spader, Hal Holbrook, Tommy Lee Jones, and Jackie Earle Haley. programme.title: Le divorce
Rozwód po francusku
Le Divorce
programme.desc:
Le divorce: Directed by James Ivory. With Kate Hudson, Jean-Marie Lhomme, Naomi Watts, Esmée Buchet-Deàk. French vs. American social customs and behaviors are observed in a story about an American visiting her Frenchman-wed sister in Paris." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0306734/","name":"Le divorce","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUxMjQ0MDgzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNjM1MDY2._V1_.jpg","description":"French vs. American social customs and behaviors are observed in a story about an American visiting her Frenchman-wed sister in Paris.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0306734/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"robertwb"},"dateCreated":"2004-03-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Another arrogant American look at Native Europeans","reviewBody":"The posters and other advertising material for this film make one think that 'Le Divorce' is a sweet and charming Parisian romantic comedy, but instead the audience is subjected to nearly two hours of poorly thought-out characters, a plot that goes nowhere, depressing lives and confusing motives.

'Le Divorce' is a conspicuously anti-male and anti-French film. Virtually every (French) male character is either selfish, arrogant, slimy, stupid or all of the above. Is every French man so worthless? 

Why set a film in France if you are only going to ridicule and complain about the French? It's as if the filmmakers seem to think that only Americans know what is truly right and wrong and everyone else is either backwards or dumb. 

The American attitude to other cultures is so condescending that one feels physically sick. In one scene, Glen Close's character thinks aloud about writing a book about the French and their strange ways, as if she were a Christian missionary or Imperialist, wanting to chronicle the quaint ways of the 'natives'. In another scene on a train someone asks "Is this the Middle Ages?", with the reply being, "No, this is France". Since Americans in general seem so intimidated by European culture and intelligence they feel they must deride all native Europeans in such a manner. 

 Naomi Watts, someone whom I admire greatly, was so uninteresting and morose that I was glad whenever she left a scene. Whenever someone voiced an opinion or idea that was not 'hip-PC' then her character would grumble.

'Le Divorce' was tough going, it wasn't entertaining in any way, nor is it a film I would recommend to anyone else."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11339,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2003-08-29","keywords":"american,french,love,sex,france","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Le Divorce","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1636958489","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODIxZDhmOTUtZDE5OS00M2RlLWJkM2ItYjQxMjE2YWE0MjE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODIxZDhmOTUtZDE5OS00M2RlLWJkM2ItYjQxMjE2YWE0MjE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pre"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005028/","name":"Kate Hudson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0915208/","name":"Naomi Watts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000330/","name":"Stockard Channing"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0412465/","name":"James Ivory"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0055367/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023815/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0424956/","name":"Diane Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0695609/","name":"Ruth Prawer Jhabvala"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0412465/","name":"James Ivory"}],"duration":"PT1H57M"}</script><metacontent="

When her family misses her jump roping competition, a 16-year-old girl and her siblings hold their parents hostage, hoping to correct their unsatisfying behavior." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1821426/","name":"Family Weekend","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg2MTAwNTE0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjEwMDgwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When her family misses her jump roping competition, a 16-year-old girl and her siblings hold their parents hostage, hoping to correct their unsatisfying behavior.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1821426/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"klaus-254-632336"},"dateCreated":"2013-03-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Olesya Rulin steals the show","reviewBody":"Family Weekend is a a really fun family comedy with heart. The movie features surprisingly good acting all around, but Olesya Rulin steals the show!

The movie centers on a high school speed jumper who's dysfunctional family lets her down, and her desperate attempt to write the ship before it's too late. Kristin Chenoweth and Matthew Modine are fantastically convincing on the dysfunctional side, and Joey King's performance is both skin-crawlingly creep and endearing and truly unexpected from such a young star.

Regarding Rulin's, her performance is spot on, and he portrays both her strong competitive side and vulnerable side flawlessly. She engages and keeps the audience's attention, and though her character is weird and quirky, we all want her to succeed. To quote Kelly Golighty "She reminds me of Audrey Hepburn in My Fair Lady with a dash of Lucille Ball thrown in for good measure."","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6883,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2013-03-29","keywords":"tape over mouth,tied feet","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi256354073","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDkwODQ0ODE5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU5NDIzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDkwODQ0ODE5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU5NDIzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Frustrated by her parent's lack of support and guidance, 16-year-old Emily takes her mom and dad hostage after they miss her big jump-roping competition in hopes that it will restore order in their home."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0155693/","name":"Kristin Chenoweth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000546/","name":"Matthew Modine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0750037/","name":"Olesya Rulin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1219307/","name":"Benjamin Epps"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0291634/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014925/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3213569/","name":"Matt K. Turner"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

The movie features surprisingly good acting all around, but Olesya Rulin steals the show!

The movie centers on a high school speed jumper who's dysfunctional family lets her down, and her desperate attempt to write the ship before it's too late. Kristin Chenoweth and Matthew Modine are fantastically convincing on the dysfunctional side, and Joey King's performance is both skin-crawlingly creep and endearing and truly unexpected from such a young star.

Regarding Rulin's, her performance is spot on, and he portrays both her strong competitive side and vulnerable side flawlessly. She engages and keeps the audience's attention, and though her character is weird and quirky, we all want her to succeed. programme.title: Robin Hood
Robin Hood
programme.desc:
Robin Hood: Directed by Ridley Scott. With Russell Crowe, Cate Blanchett, Max von Sydow, William Hurt. In twelfth-century England, Robin Longstride and his band of marauders confront corruption in a local village and lead an uprising against the crown that will forever alter the balance of world power." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0955308/","name":"Robin Hood","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM5NzcwMzEwOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjg5MTgwMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In twelfth-century England, Robin Longstride and his band of marauders confront corruption in a local village and lead an uprising against the crown that will forever alter the balance of world power.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0955308/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"provenelk"},"dateCreated":"2010-05-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Exciting and original take on Robin Hood","reviewBody":"First off, i want to say how refreshing it is for a big summer movie not to be on the band wagon of CGI or 3-D. At last a straight up movie not relying on any gimmicks!

Robin Hood delivers what it promises. Solid action, good narrative, and the inclusion of a bit of history with action between England and France gives the movie an added meat and almost realistic feel to it. The dialogue is a bit ropey at times, and Robin's "merry men" could have had a bit more screen time, but otherwise i see no major fault with this movie.

All in all a refreshing, exciting, fun, entertaining, nothing that you wouldn't expect from the pairing of Russel Crowe and Ridley Scott.

7/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":261207,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"2010-05-12","keywords":"archer,robin hood character,england,1190s,king of england","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Robin Hood: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi73860121","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY3ODEzMjMxMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDU4MzczMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY3ODEzMjMxMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDU4MzczMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of an archer in the army of Richard Coeur de Lion who fights against the Norman invaders and becomes the legendary hero known as Robin Hood."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000128/","name":"Russell Crowe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000949/","name":"Cate Blanchett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0532193/","name":"Matthew Macfadyen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000631/","name":"Ridley Scott"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001338/","name":"Brian Helgeland"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0717550/","name":"Ethan Reiff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0903456/","name":"Cyrus Voris"}],"duration":"PT2H20M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Seules les bêtes: Directed by Dominik Moll. With Denis Ménochet, Laure Calamy, Damien Bonnard, Nadia Tereszkiewicz. A woman disappeared. After a snowstorm, her car is discovered on a road to a small remote village. While the police don't know where to start, five people are linked to the disappearance. Each one with his or her own secret." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10409498/","name":"Seules les bêtes","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjJkMDgzNzUtZWQwMi00ZWNmLWJhYTMtZmRkMmEwZTM2YTg1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTM1MTE1NDMx._V1_.jpg","description":"A woman disappeared. Each one with his or her own secret.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10409498/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"A-90"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"A clever slow burn","reviewBody":"I really enjoyed this. A slow burn of a story, simmering away just enough to keep you hooked. A portrayal of the isolation and desperation of people wanting to escape their own lives (for all reasons from mundanity to poverty). Some are even so desperate they are happy to lie to themselves if it means they can live in a fantasy world rather than their own. Sad, clever, human, understated. A rare gem.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4657,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2019-12-04","keywords":"talking to a dead body,disposing of a dead body,older woman younger woman sex,romance scam,suicide","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [English SUB]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3986734617","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODcwMDhjNWYtMTI4Ny00NGIxLThhZDctMzY1ZmI4NTJiMzRhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODcwMDhjNWYtMTI4Ny00NGIxLThhZDctMzY1ZmI4NTJiMzRhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1616970/","name":"Denis Ménochet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2662182/","name":"Laure Calamy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4044784/","name":"Damien Bonnard"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0596962/","name":"Dominik Moll"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030799/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0148706/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044140/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10727187/","name":"Colin Niel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0596962/","name":"Dominik Moll"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0545382/","name":"Gilles Marchand"}],"duration":"PT1H57M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Family Weekend
Rodzinny weekend
Family Weekend
programme.desc:
Family Weekend: Directed by Benjamin Epps. With Kristin Chenoweth, Matthew Modine, Olesya Rulin, Joey King. When her family misses her jump roping competition, a 16-year-old girl and her siblings hold their parents hostage, hoping to correct their unsatisfying behavior." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1821426/","name":"Family Weekend","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg2MTAwNTE0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjEwMDgwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When her family misses her jump roping competition, a 16-year-old girl and her siblings hold their parents hostage, hoping to correct their unsatisfying behavior.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1821426/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"klaus-254-632336"},"dateCreated":"2013-03-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Olesya Rulin steals the show","reviewBody":"Family Weekend is a a really fun family comedy with heart. The movie features surprisingly good acting all around, but Olesya Rulin steals the show!

The movie centers on a high school speed jumper who's dysfunctional family lets her down, and her desperate attempt to write the ship before it's too late. Kristin Chenoweth and Matthew Modine are fantastically convincing on the dysfunctional side, and Joey King's performance is both skin-crawlingly creep and endearing and truly unexpected from such a young star.

Regarding Rulin's, her performance is spot on, and he portrays both her strong competitive side and vulnerable side flawlessly. She engages and keeps the audience's attention, and though her character is weird and quirky, we all want her to succeed. To quote Kelly Golighty "She reminds me of Audrey Hepburn in My Fair Lady with a dash of Lucille Ball thrown in for good measure."","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6883,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2013-03-29","keywords":"tape over mouth,tied feet","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi256354073","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDkwODQ0ODE5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU5NDIzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDkwODQ0ODE5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU5NDIzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Frustrated by her parent's lack of support and guidance, 16-year-old Emily takes her mom and dad hostage after they miss her big jump-roping competition in hopes that it will restore order in their home."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0155693/","name":"Kristin Chenoweth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000546/","name":"Matthew Modine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0750037/","name":"Olesya Rulin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1219307/","name":"Benjamin Epps"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0291634/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014925/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3213569/","name":"Matt K. programme.title: Knuckledust
Klub Knuckledust
Knuckledust
programme.desc:
Knuckledust: Directed by James Kermack. With Kate Dickie, Olivier Richters, Camille Rowe, Phil Davis. When a special police task force kick open the doors of elite underground fight den - Club Knuckledust, they find seven levels of hell, filled with the dead bodies of countless fighters, assassins and goons. Only one man, beaten to a pulp, barely breathing, is still alive: Hard Eight. With a shady Government official en route to take him away, Chief Inspector Katherine Keaton and her team have ninety minutes to interrogate Hard Eight to find out if is the lone survivor or a multiple murderer. With lies flying from everyone's mouths and corruption becoming apparent, Keaton starts to wonder "Who is the real criminal?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9109072/","name":"Knuckledust","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDU5ZjYwOTgtMjAyOS00YWY0LWJjYjEtY2M5NzRhN2MwOTIxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTMwNzY2MzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a special police task force kick open the doors of elite underground fight den - Club Knuckledust, they find seven levels of hell, filled with the dead bodies of countless fighters, assassins and goons. Not normally one for violent cinema but this was clever, quirky, consistently funny and always visually arresting

There is nothing better than watching something and having no idea where it will take you. Felt like Alice in Wonderland.

Strong performances from a large ensemble cast led by brooding Moe Dunford and the always excellent Kate Dickie, with some choice cameos and some killer dialogue. Director James Kermack (who also plays a supporting role) is one to watch.
