programme.title: Phoenix, Oregon
Phoenix w Oregonie
Phoenix, Oregon
programme.desc: Phoenix, Oregon: Directed by Gary Lundgren. With James Le Gros, Jesse Borrego, Lisa Edelstein, Diedrich Bader. Two longtime friends battle mid-life crisis by opening a bowling alley/pizzeria in their small hometown." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8586088/","name":"Phoenix, Oregon","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDlhMGRlYzctNWYzOC00NmE3LWE3MWQtNDk4NmNiODUwMTcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzQxOTU3NjU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two longtime friends battle mid-life crisis by opening a bowling alley/pizzeria in their small hometown.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8586088/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"LilyWai"},"dateCreated":"2020-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Genuine","reviewBody":"Loved this film, a little sweet snapshot of how droll the midlife grind can be when you don't have the life you thought you'd have. Great understated performance from James LeGros as Bobby, and the full cast of his friends & associates offer plenty of dramatic layers for his character to engage with. Jesse Borego as Carlos is a breath of fresh air to Bobby's downer moments & his passion for his craft is infectious. I appreciated the fumbled semi romantic thread between Bobby and Tanya too as too often in movies it's all packaged up so neatly the viewer is deprived of seeing the truth when it comes to 'just not the right time' connections. Oh and have to mention Kevin Corrigan's Al, nicely positioned in both character and storyline as Bobby's polar opposite nemesis. Highly recommend but one negative is I almost passed this by thanks to the insipid title. Two longtime friends battle mid-life crisis by opening a bowling alley/pizzeria in their small hometown." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8586088/","name":"Phoenix, Oregon","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDlhMGRlYzctNWYzOC00NmE3LWE3MWQtNDk4NmNiODUwMTcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzQxOTU3NjU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two longtime friends battle mid-life crisis by opening a bowling alley/pizzeria in their small hometown.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8586088/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"LilyWai","dateCreated":"2020-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Genuine","reviewBody":"Loved this film, a little sweet snapshot of how droll the midlife grind can be when you don't have the life you thought you'd have. Great understated performance from James LeGros as Bobby, and the full cast of his friends & associates offer plenty of dramatic layers for his character to engage with. Jesse Borego as Carlos is a breath of fresh air to Bobby's downer moments & his passion for his craft is infectious. I appreciated the fumbled semi romantic thread between Bobby and Tanya too as too often in movies it's all packaged up so neatly the viewer is deprived of seeing the truth when it comes to 'just not the right time' connections. Oh and have to mention Kevin Corrigan's Al, nicely positioned in both character and storyline as Bobby's polar opposite nemesis. Highly recommend but one negative is I almost passed this by thanks to the insipid title. I get the 'Phoenix' connection in the storyline but come on, something a little more thoughtful would be cherry on the top.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":339,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2020-03-20","keywords":"battle","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [EN]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3567762969","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjZkZmZlM2YtYzgwZi00YTBiLTg2MmUtYWFhYjFjOWI3ODgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjZkZmZlM2YtYzgwZi00YTBiLTg2MmUtYWFhYjFjOWI3ODgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001457/","name":"James Le Gros","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001963/","name":"Jesse Borrego","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0249046/","name":"Lisa Edelstein"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1390437/","name":"Gary Lundgren"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0324375/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1390437/","name":"Gary Lundgren"],"duration":"PT1H48M"</script><metacontent="

After their friend dies in an accident, Marcell, the rich but burnt-out architect and the rest of his loser childhood buddies decide to team up for the last time to fulfill their friend's last wish by smuggling his crappy painting into the most prestigious art auction of Budapest." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10319486/","name":"Pesti balhé","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzRmOWM2YjctODRkOC00MDgyLWIwNGUtZjNlMGVmZDgwMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTgzOTI4MzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"After their friend dies in an accident, Marcell, the rich but burnt-out architect and the rest of his loser childhood buddies decide to team up for the last time to fulfill their friend's last wish by smuggling his crappy painting in","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10319486/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"blacklivematters"},"dateCreated":"2020-08-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"A charming reverse heist","reviewBody":"It was quite refreshing to see a new takle on the heist genre with this little gem. In most heist movies they try to bust a bank or a casino, while in this one it's the opposite, they steal a painting into an auction. How come nobody had this idea before? programme.title: We're No Angels
Nie jesteśmy aniołami
We're No Angels
programme.desc:
We're No Angels: Directed by Neil Jordan. With Robert De Niro, Sean Penn, Demi Moore, Hoyt Axton. Two escaped cons only prayer to escape is to pass themselves off as priests and pass by the police blockade at the border into the safety of Canada." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0098625/","name":"We're No Angels","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWQ3YWQ5NjMtNTVlZi00ZTk2LWFjZDctYjNiNzVhYjllMjFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzk1NzcyOTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two escaped cons only prayer to escape is to pass themselves off as priests and pass by the police blockade at the border into the safety of Canada.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0098625/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"PredragReviews"},"dateCreated":"2017-04-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Could be better.","reviewBody":""We're No Angels" is a movie made for those faces, and one of the pleasures of watching the film is to see them looking sidelong at each other as they try to figure a way out of the complicated mess they're in. The movie has a lot of other good stuff to look at (including dramatic period locations in a small Canadian town) and to listen to (dialogue by David Mamet), but I can think of no other recent movie in which so much of the pleasure lies in watching the expressions on the faces of the actors - especially when they're reacting, not talking. Mamet and Neil Jordan, who directed the movie, wisely remember the most important thing about any mistaken- identity comedy: The fact that someone's identity is mistaken is not always funny even the first time and rarely thereafter. Movies that depend on mistaken identities for their laughs are among the slowest, dreariest slogs through cinema.

Too bad that the film came out to be both simplistic and ordinary despite of the talent involved especially when it features De Niro and Penn,two of the best actors in Hollywood; and Jordan,one of the finest director of the industry.There were a lot of boring moments.Also,it just turned out to be somewhat corny and provides minimal laughter in a lot of scenes.Overall,it was definitely a misfire from the cast and the director involved as it does not live up to its potential.

Overall rating: 6 out of 10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":22742,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1989-12-15","keywords":"lingerie slip,superstition,pig,cross,contraction in title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"We're No Angels","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1578483225","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWJiY2VjMDgtYWU5OC00NDllLTlmOTctM2Y0MzQ2NmRiNmM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWJiY2VjMDgtYWU5OC00NDllLTlmOTctM2Y0MzQ2NmRiNmM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000134/","name":"Robert De Niro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000576/","name":"Sean Penn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000193/","name":"Demi Moore"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001403/","name":"Neil Jordan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000519/","name":"David Mamet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0532030/","name":"Ranald MacDougall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0404062/","name":"Albert Husson"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

The movie has a lot of other good stuff to look at (including dramatic period locations in a small Canadian town) and to listen to (dialogue by David Mamet), but I can think of no other recent movie in which so much of the pleasure lies in watching the expressions on the faces of the actors - especially when they're reacting, not talking. Mamet and Neil Jordan, who directed the movie, wisely remember the most important thing about any mistaken- identity comedy: The fact that someone's identity is mistaken is not always funny even the first time and rarely thereafter. Movies that depend on mistaken identities for their laughs are among the slowest, dreariest slogs through cinema.

Too bad that the film came out to be both simplistic and ordinary despite of the talent involved especially when it features De Niro and Penn,two of the best actors in Hollywood; and Jordan,one of the finest director of the industry.There were a lot of boring moments.Also,it just turned out to be somewhat corny and provides minimal laughter in a lot of scenes.Overall,it was definitely a misfire from the cast and the director involved as it does not live up to its potential.

Overall rating: 6 out of 10.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":22742,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1989-12-15","keywords":"lingerie slip,superstition,pig,cross,contraction in title","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"We're No Angels","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1578483225","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWJiY2VjMDgtYWU5OC00NDllLTlmOTctM2Y0MzQ2NmRiNmM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWJiY2VjMDgtYWU5OC00NDllLTlmOTctM2Y0MzQ2NmRiNmM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000134/","name":"Robert De Niro","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000576/","name":"Sean Penn","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000193/","name":"Demi Moore"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001403/","name":"Neil Jordan"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000519/","name":"David Mamet","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0532030/","name":"Ranald MacDougall","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0404062/","name":"Albert Husson"],"duration":"PT1H46M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Filles de joie
Pracujące dziewczyny
Filles de joie
programme.desc: Filles de joie: Directed by Frédéric Fonteyne, Anne Paulicevich. With Sara Forestier, Noémie Lvovsky, Annabelle Lengronne, Nicolas Cazalé. Everyday, three sex workers cross the border from France into Belgium to practice their trade. At the end of one particularly hot summer, all three share a secret that will bind them together forever." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11018402/","name":"Filles de joie","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGVjZGVhYmMtOGUyMi00YTMzLTlhNmQtNWZmYzY2NzkzODJmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjIxNzQ2ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Everyday, three sex workers cross the border from France into Belgium to practice their trade. At the end of one particularly hot summer, all three share a secret that will bind them together forever.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11018402/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TheHound16"},"dateCreated":"2021-01-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"An engaging and layered insight to three women making a living","reviewBody":"I wasn't sure what to expect going into this film - I hadn't actually read up on it beforehand, and only knew it was an Oscar contender. After having seen it, I'm very happy I did, and recommend it to others. The acting was utterly superb, from all three stars. The film has a way of introducing and going into each character that I feel worked very well. We basically get the perspective of each character, and any characters we may not initially feel so connected to are quickly given layers as their life is revealed, so that we strongly empathize with them. These characters and their situation are extremely complex, and yet no matter what is done, we end up completely understanding where they are coming from. It's very easy to write certain characters as stereotypes, but nearly everyone in this film is given sufficient depth, which keeps the audience engaged and interested the entire film. The pacing was excellent, all the way through, and I have to really commend the writer for how well-written each scene was. The direction, as well, felt very natural, and fluid, keeping strongly with the tone of the film. All around, I very much recommend this film, and am very happy to see this subject matter be handled so well and compassionately.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":812,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-02-12","keywords":"prostitution,male frontal nudity,male nudity,female nudity,sex work","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3466837529","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWEzMzA1ZTUtMGFkYS00NzhjLWI1YTktNmI0NjExMWUwOGY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWEzMzA1ZTUtMGFkYS00NzhjLWI1YTktNmI0NjExMWUwOGY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1271759/","name":"Sara Forestier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0527852/","name":"Noémie Lvovsky"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4779334/","name":"Annabelle Lengronne"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0285090/","name":"Frédéric Fonteyne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2973991/","name":"Anne Paulicevich"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0071388/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0076118/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048473/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2973991/","name":"Anne Paulicevich"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Platzspitzbaby
Dziewczynka z Parku Igieł
Platzspitzbaby
programme.desc:
Platzspitzbaby: Directed by Pierre Monnard. With Jerry Hoffmann, Sarah Spale, Luna Mwezi, Michael Schertenleib. Spring 1995 - after the closure of the Needle Park in Zurich, 11-Year- Old Mia and her heroin addicted mother Sandrine are relocated to the countryside." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9737798/","name":"Platzspitzbaby","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjIzZWM5MWUtZTZjNS00NmQ4LTljODktMmQ0Mjc2YzRkMTk4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTU1ODM0NzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Spring 1995 - after the closure of the Needle Park in Zurich, 11-Year- Old Mia and her heroin addicted mother Sandrine are relocated to the countryside.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9737798/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"fxOCR"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Amazing","reviewBody":"Made an account here on IMDB, just to recommend this movie. Apparently only ONE other recommended this? This is one of the best movies I've watched in a long time. I stumbled upon this movie by chance, and decided to give it a try. It was very much worth it!! I haven't watched any Swiss film before, at least to my knowledge?

It's absolutely amazing. The acting from both Sarah Spale and Luna Mwezi is sublime and extremely believable. At times it's really hard to get through, since the story revolving around Mia and her mom is very sad and somewhat depressing. The daily struggle of the daughter Mia, trying to help her mother, is very touching, although very sad.

I had to stop the movie a few times, just to get a break. Definitely cried through a lot of the tough scenes. I had to remind myself it's "just" a movie, but it felt very real.

IMDb data; ttnr: 9737798, Title: Platzspitzbaby, --- Description: Platzspitzbaby: Directed by Pierre Monnard. With Jerry Hoffmann, Sarah Spale, Luna Mwezi, Michael Schertenleib. Spring 1995 - after the closure of the Needle Park in Zurich, 11-Year- Old Mia and her heroin addicted mother Sandrine are relocated to the countryside." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9737798/","name":"Platzspitzbaby","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjIzZWM5MWUtZTZjNS00NmQ4LTljODktMmQ0Mjc2YzRkMTk4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTU1ODM0NzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Spring 1995 - after the closure of the Needle Park in Zurich, 11-Year- Old Mia and her heroin addicted mother Sandrine are relocated to the countryside.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9737798/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"fxOCR","dateCreated":"2020-12-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Amazing","reviewBody":"Made an account here on IMDB, just to recommend this movie. Apparently only ONE other recommended this? This is one of the best movies I've watched in a long time. I stumbled upon this movie by chance, and decided to give it a try. It was very much worth it!! I haven't watched any Swiss film before, at least to my knowledge?

It's absolutely amazing. The acting from both Sarah Spale and Luna Mwezi is sublime and extremely believable. At times it's really hard to get through, since the story revolving around Mia and her mom is very sad and somewhat depressing. The daily struggle of the daughter Mia, trying to help her mother, is very touching, although very sad.

I had to stop the movie a few times, just to get a break. Definitely cried through a lot of the tough scenes. I had to remind myself it's "just" a movie, but it felt very real.

Anyways, if you get a chance to watch this movie - I thoroughly recommend you should.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":641,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2,"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-11-18","keywords":"mother daughter relationship,coming of age,drug addicted woman","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Platzspitzbaby","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1005371161","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjRkYzQyZTEtM2Y4My00MTg3LWI4MWItNWVkNGQ3YWQzNzUyXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjRkYzQyZTEtM2Y4My00MTg3LWI4MWItNWVkNGQ3YWQzNzUyXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 1","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3768173/","name":"Jerry Hoffmann","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1282623/","name":"Sarah Spale","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10457412/","name":"Luna Mwezi"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1301190/","name":"Pierre Monnard"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0075448/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1825205/","name":"André Küttel","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10457413/","name":"Michelle Halbheer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11979752/","name":"Franziska K. Days of Heaven
programme.desc: Days of Heaven: Directed by Terrence Malick. With Richard Gere, Brooke Adams, Sam Shepard, Linda Manz. A hot-tempered farm laborer convinces the woman he loves to marry their rich but dying boss so that they can have a claim to his fortune." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0077405/","name":"Days of Heaven","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjMyZmU4OGYtNjBiYS00YTIxLWJjMDUtZjczZmQwMTM4YjQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTI4MjkwNjA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A hot-tempered farm laborer convinces the woman he loves to marry their rich but dying boss so that they can have a claim to his fortune.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0077405/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"katsat"},"dateCreated":"2002-03-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the most haunting and beautiful films ever made","reviewBody":"If any movie could be called filmed poetry, this would be it. From its first opening shot to its last frame, there is such lyricism and emotion and beauty that it almost leaves you speechless. I have not seen this movie in years, but it still affects me and I want to write about it. There is a pervading sadness to the movie, like a memory of something wonderful that could have been, that should have been, that almost was, and is all the more tragic because it was in your hands but slipped through your fingers. This is not a movie for everyone, but if you believe that film can be one of the highest forms of art, this is the film to see.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55962,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1978-10-06","keywords":"farm,train,wealth,farm worker,seasonal work","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi320650777","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzJiMmI5OWYtMzFiNC00NjYyLWJhNzctOWViM2VmOTM2YWE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzJiMmI5OWYtMzFiNC00NjYyLWJhNzctOWViM2VmOTM2YWE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000152/","name":"Richard Gere"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000724/","name":"Brooke Adams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001731/","name":"Sam Shepard"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000517/","name":"Terrence Malick"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000517/","name":"Terrence Malick"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Stille hjerte
Spokój w sercu
Stille hjerte
programme.desc:
Stille hjerte: Directed by Bille August. With Ghita Nørby, Paprika Steen, Danica Curcic, Morten Grunwald. Three generations of a family coming together over a weekend. A sick mother's wish to die before her disease worsens gets harder to handle as old conflicts come to the surface." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3335048/","name":"Stille hjerte","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU0OTE1YzgtMGQ1My00ZmNiLThkMWQtZTkwMmNiZmYyNjFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDYxOTY1Njg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three generations of a family coming together over a weekend. A sick mother's wish to die before her disease worsens gets harder to handle as old conflicts come to the surface.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3335048/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JvH48"},"dateCreated":"2016-07-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent situational plot around euthanasia, with ample complications and unexpected turns of events. Everyone's motives and reasoning are portrayed very well","reviewBody":"Saw this at the Noordelijk film festival 2015 in Leeuwarden (NL). It all starts with a small family gathering over the weekend, nothing out of the ordinary at first sight. Rather than getting into the usual annoyances and uneasy relationships common with family in law, or old bones to pick between brothers and sisters, the weekend starts unproblematic. Plans have been made previously for a do-it-yourself form of euthanasia, which is illegal almost everywhere. Yet we learn that everyone involved has accepted the procedure. The timing is such that the mother can take the pills by herself, without help, something not possible anymore when her illness worsens, the latter due in 1 or 2 months. Her husband can say that she did it all by herself while he took a walk, particularly important as a precaution because as a doctor he certainly cannot be suspected of any active involvement in such a procedure.

The group of relatives assembled for the weekend in question is well chosen, from a plot perspective, with very diverse characters and attitudes, albeit that there are not so many family members that we lose track on the respective opinions and motives. In spite of the a priori agreement on the whole process, we observe that some are getting cold feet and we see them wanting to postpone or even dismiss the whole procedure. Reasons for it vary but are certainly genuine and we can follow their trains of thought very well. These withdrawals happen with one after the other, each with different motives, and each eventually coming along and prepared to stick to the original plan. It sounds confusing but the script is well designed and the timing is perfect.

One example, to illustrate the sort of objections, is that one daughter regrets that she did not spend enough time with her mother in the past, having given more thought to her career and other priorities elsewhere. Now that she has more time on her hands, she welcomes the opportunity to renew the relationship with her mother, and to discuss matters of mutual interest. This is something that I can understand fully, as having similar ideas myself over having not spent sufficient time with my parents, in spite of them devoting ample time to me when I was young. A second argument of the daughter is that doctors can be wrong in their predictions, in other words that the planned euthanasia is much too soon, and that medicine can be invented in the meantime to prolong her life for many years to come. All this is just an example of aforementioned turns of events, everything just rational and understandable, yet endangering the plans that were so well thought through.

It is an achievement in itself that it all happened on screen within 97 minutes, in a limited time span in which not a second was wasted, letting events pass by in a logical order and evenly spread over time. Don't assume an overall gloomy atmosphere, since there is ample humor included in spite of the circumstances.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1752,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-11-13","keywords":"weekend,family relationships,euthanasia","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0639152/","name":"Ghita Nørby"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0824785/","name":"Paprika Steen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4439530/","name":"Danica Curcic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000806/","name":"Bille August"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0249327/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054911/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048411/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1311535/","name":"Christian Torpe"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Platzspitzbaby
Dziewczynka z Parku Igieł
Platzspitzbaby
programme.desc:
Platzspitzbaby: Directed by Pierre Monnard. With Jerry Hoffmann, Sarah Spale, Luna Mwezi, Michael Schertenleib. Spring 1995 - after the closure of the Needle Park in Zurich, 11-Year- Old Mia and her heroin addicted mother Sandrine are relocated to the countryside." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9737798/","name":"Platzspitzbaby","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjIzZWM5MWUtZTZjNS00NmQ4LTljODktMmQ0Mjc2YzRkMTk4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTU1ODM0NzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Spring 1995 - after the closure of the Needle Park in Zurich, 11-Year- Old Mia and her heroin addicted mother Sandrine are relocated to the countryside.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9737798/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"fxOCR"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Amazing","reviewBody":"Made an account here on IMDB, just to recommend this movie. Apparently only ONE other recommended this? This is one of the best movies I've watched in a long time. I stumbled upon this movie by chance, and decided to give it a try. It was very much worth it!! I haven't watched any Swiss film before, at least to my knowledge?

It's absolutely amazing. The acting from both Sarah Spale and Luna Mwezi is sublime and extremely believable. At times it's really hard to get through, since the story revolving around Mia and her mom is very sad and somewhat depressing. The daily struggle of the daughter Mia, trying to help her mother, is very touching, although very sad.

I had to stop the movie a few times, just to get a break. Definitely cried through a lot of the tough scenes. I had to remind myself it's "just" a movie, but it felt very real.

IMDb data; ttnr: 9737798, Title: Platzspitzbaby, --- Description: Platzspitzbaby: Directed by Pierre Monnard. With Jerry Hoffmann, Sarah Spale, Luna Mwezi, Michael Schertenleib. Spring 1995 - after the closure of the Needle Park in Zurich, 11-Year- Old Mia and her heroin addicted mother Sandrine are relocated to the countryside." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9737798/","name":"Platzspitzbaby","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjIzZWM5MWUtZTZjNS00NmQ4LTljODktMmQ0Mjc2YzRkMTk4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTU1ODM0NzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Spring 1995 - after the closure of the Needle Park in Zurich, 11-Year- Old Mia and her heroin addicted mother Sandrine are relocated to the countryside.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9737798/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"fxOCR","dateCreated":"2020-12-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Amazing","reviewBody":"Made an account here on IMDB, just to recommend this movie. Apparently only ONE other recommended this? This is one of the best movies I've watched in a long time. I stumbled upon this movie by chance, and decided to give it a try. It was very much worth it!! I haven't watched any Swiss film before, at least to my knowledge?

It's absolutely amazing. The acting from both Sarah Spale and Luna Mwezi is sublime and extremely believable. At times it's really hard to get through, since the story revolving around Mia and her mom is very sad and somewhat depressing. The daily struggle of the daughter Mia, trying to help her mother, is very touching, although very sad.

I had to stop the movie a few times, just to get a break. Definitely cried through a lot of the tough scenes. I had to remind myself it's "just" a movie, but it felt very real.

Anyways, if you get a chance to watch this movie - I thoroughly recommend you should.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":641,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2,"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-11-18","keywords":"mother daughter relationship,coming of age,drug addicted woman","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Platzspitzbaby","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1005371161","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjRkYzQyZTEtM2Y4My00MTg3LWI4MWItNWVkNGQ3YWQzNzUyXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjRkYzQyZTEtM2Y4My00MTg3LWI4MWItNWVkNGQ3YWQzNzUyXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 1","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3768173/","name":"Jerry Hoffmann","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1282623/","name":"Sarah Spale","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10457412/","name":"Luna Mwezi"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1301190/","name":"Pierre Monnard"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0075448/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1825205/","name":"André Küttel","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10457413/","name":"Michelle Halbheer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11979752/","name":"Franziska K. Days of Heaven
programme.desc: Days of Heaven: Directed by Terrence Malick. With Richard Gere, Brooke Adams, Sam Shepard, Linda Manz. A hot-tempered farm laborer convinces the woman he loves to marry their rich but dying boss so that they can have a claim to his fortune." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0077405/","name":"Days of Heaven","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjMyZmU4OGYtNjBiYS00YTIxLWJjMDUtZjczZmQwMTM4YjQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTI4MjkwNjA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A hot-tempered farm laborer convinces the woman he loves to marry their rich but dying boss so that they can have a claim to his fortune.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0077405/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"katsat"},"dateCreated":"2002-03-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the most haunting and beautiful films ever made","reviewBody":"If any movie could be called filmed poetry, this would be it. From its first opening shot to its last frame, there is such lyricism and emotion and beauty that it almost leaves you speechless. I have not seen this movie in years, but it still affects me and I want to write about it. There is a pervading sadness to the movie, like a memory of something wonderful that could have been, that should have been, that almost was, and is all the more tragic because it was in your hands but slipped through your fingers. This is not a movie for everyone, but if you believe that film can be one of the highest forms of art, this is the film to see.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55962,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1978-10-06","keywords":"farm,train,wealth,farm worker,seasonal work","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi320650777","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzJiMmI5OWYtMzFiNC00NjYyLWJhNzctOWViM2VmOTM2YWE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzJiMmI5OWYtMzFiNC00NjYyLWJhNzctOWViM2VmOTM2YWE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000152/","name":"Richard Gere"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000724/","name":"Brooke Adams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001731/","name":"Sam Shepard"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000517/","name":"Terrence Malick"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000517/","name":"Terrence Malick"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Krawiec
programme.desc: Niklos (Dimitris Imellos) jest dorosłym mężczyzną, któremu nie powodzi się w życiu. Jego rodzinny warsztat krawiecki grozi bankructwem, a on sam może stracić dach nad głową, gdyż mieszka na strychu zakładu. Jednak widmo porażki finansowej mobilizuje go do działania. Niklos otwiera swój prywatny obwoźny zakład krawiecki. Na rowerze przemierza kolejne kilometry, zmienia całkiem swoje życie i po raz pierwszy się zakochuje. Sympatyczna opowieść o powolnym wkraczaniu w jesień życia.

Neidentificat
programme.desc:
Neidentificat: Directed by Bogdan George Apetri. With Bogdan Farcas, Dragos Dumitru, Vasile Muraru, Emanuel Parvu. An unsolved case. An unknown criminal. An obsessed cop. His investigation plunges him into a world of darkness and violence, pulling everyone around him into a web of destructive passion and revenge." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt13099426/","name":"Neidentificat","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjA4YTQxMTktYTdhOS00MjZkLWIzOGYtNDNhMTY5YWI4ZGNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDc2NTQxMDA@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unsolved case. An unknown criminal. An obsessed cop. His investigation plunges him into a world of darkness and violence, pulling everyone around him into a web of destructive passion and revenge.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt13099426/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dragos-87152"},"dateCreated":"2021-11-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Hidden gem","reviewBody":"First of all, I can't believe I am the first reviewer on Imdb for this outstanding film... I feel compelled to advertise it, as I am a romanian and I have to admit, this film made me proud.

Nevertheless, I will be as objective as I can.

"Unidentified" is a slow burn drama, very well acted, sharply written, with excellent camera work and great use of classical music, basically it has all the necessary ingredients of a solid film (yes, it deserves to be adressed as film, not as movie).

It is one of 2021's hidden gems and you don't have to be a romanian to recognize this fact.

9 out of 10 stars. I gave it such a high score also because It feels so amazing to have such a pleasant cinematic surprise every once in a while and I am honoured to write it's first review here.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":194,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-10-12","keywords":"neo noir","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Unidentified (2020) - International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3824140313","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YwYmFkMjQtODFmMi00MjZiLTk4ZGUtNWVkYTUyMjBhYTc0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YwYmFkMjQtODFmMi00MjZiLTk4ZGUtNWVkYTUyMjBhYTc0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6030704/","name":"Bogdan Farcas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4568761/","name":"Dragos Dumitru"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0613555/","name":"Vasile Muraru"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3054794/","name":"Bogdan George Apetri"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0110093/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0001222/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056024/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3054794/","name":"Bogdan George Apetri"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2462431/","name":"Iulian Postelnicu"}],"duration":"PT2H3M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Winter's Bone
Do szpiku kości
Winter's Bone
programme.desc:
Winter's Bone: Directed by Debra Granik. With Jennifer Lawrence, Isaiah Stone, Ashlee Thompson, Valerie Richards. An unflinching Ozark Mountain girl hacks through dangerous social terrain as she hunts down her drug-dealing father while trying to keep her family intact." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1399683/","name":"Winter's Bone","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0OTM3MDMxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDY1MjI0Mw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unflinching Ozark Mountain girl hacks through dangerous social terrain as she hunts down her drug-dealing father while trying to keep her family intact.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1399683/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Loving_Silence"},"dateCreated":"2010-08-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Haunting, Grim, but somehow Optimistic","reviewBody":"Winter's Bone is about a 17 year old girl name Rolly Dee set out to find her father who put their house for his bailbond and then vanishes. If she doesn't find him, her family will be turned out to the Ozarks. Challenging her outlaw kin's code of silence and risking her life, Ree hacks through the lies, evasions and threats offered up by her relatives and begins to piece together the truth.

Let me, just begin by saying this movie is perfectly acted. Jennifer Lawrence gives an Oscar Worthy performance as Rolly Dee. I was surprised how excellent she was, because I was sceptical of her in the "The Bill Engvall" show. But she turned me to a believer and boy, she can REALLY act. Her performance actually surpasses some of Meryl Streep's performances. Hopefully the Academy will recognize her and give an Oscar nomination or maybe even a win! The film is well directed by Debra Granik and is easily her best work yet. She definitely has potential to become the "new" Kathryn Bigelow. Anyways the film is really bleak and powerful, but it still has a tone of hopeful in it. Very interesting and mesmerizing movie to watch. It is a bit slow at times, but trust me it never gets boring or dull.

10/10 Highly recommended.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":139856,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2010-07-16","keywords":"ozark mountains,family relationships,drug trade,family crisis,search for father","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Winter's Bone","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3239184153","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0MTg3OTQzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjMxMTczMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0MTg3OTQzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjMxMTczMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"17 year-old Ree Dolly (Jennifer Lawrence) sets out to track down her father, who put their house up for his bail bond and then disappeared. programme.title: Intolerable Cruelty
Okrucieństwo nie do przyjęcia
Intolerable Cruelty
programme.desc: Intolerable Cruelty: Directed by Joel Coen, Ethan Coen. With George Clooney, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Geoffrey Rush, Cedric the Entertainer. A beautiful gold digger matches wits with a shrewd Beverly Hills divorce lawyer who is increasingly attracted to her." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0138524/","name":"Intolerable Cruelty","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2OTc5Mjc0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMDYyMjg3._V1_.jpg","description":"A beautiful gold digger matches wits with a shrewd Beverly Hills divorce lawyer who is increasingly attracted to her.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0138524/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"warnerclassic"},"dateCreated":"2004-10-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not intolerable, but","reviewBody":"George Clooney stars as a self-loving whiter than white toothed lawyer who is becoming bored with his never-ending success. A challenge comes in the shapely form of Marilyn Rexroth (Catherine Zeta Jones) who wants to marry (or preferably divorce) her way to riches. With Clooney hired to represent her soon to be ex husband, he inevitably falls for the gold diggers charms.\n\nDirected by the Coen brothers, a directorial team who have helmed oddball comedies such as 'Fargo' and 'O Brother, Where Art Thou?' this is the team's first branch in to a high profile Hollywood film. Clooney, as the sharp suited lawyer, is excellent. Like Cary Grant or David Niven, Clooney is able to mock himself without compensating his screen appeal. Catherine Zeta Jones as the money hungry Marilyn is as sexy as her character demands from the scripted page. However, despite the quick fire dialogue, Intolerable Cruelty is simply not as funny as it thinks, it's cynical message of love and money taking away the romantic push it needs to place it in the league of the Tracy/Hepburn films the movie aspires to. Clooney's character also suffers from an over enthusiastic plot that later drives his character to attempt to commit a crime that totally contradicts the audiences perception of him. A battle of the sexes comedy that has sex appeal but no romance, Intolerable Cruelty is a film that reaches for the golden age of Hollywood but only touches the bronze."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":95179,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Romance"],"datePublished":"2003-12-24","keywords":"woman wears eyeglasses,strong female character,lake tahoe,reference to henry viii,deception","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Intolerable Cruelty","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi781320473","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmYzNTk4NGUtZDQ5My00MDEzLTlkZGMtNDU3MzE3MDQ0ZmI2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmYzNTk4NGUtZDQ5My00MDEzLTlkZGMtNDU3MzE3MDQ0ZmI2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001876/","name":"Catherine Zeta-Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000671/","name":"Billy Bob Thornton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001054/","name":"Joel Coen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001053/","name":"Ethan Coen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049706/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0709070/","name":"Robert Ramsey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0832043/","name":"Matthew Stone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0738908/","name":"John Romano"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Stille hjerte
Spokój w sercu
Stille hjerte
programme.desc:
Stille hjerte: Directed by Bille August. With Ghita Nørby, Paprika Steen, Danica Curcic, Morten Grunwald. Three generations of a family coming together over a weekend. A sick mother's wish to die before her disease worsens gets harder to handle as old conflicts come to the surface." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3335048/","name":"Stille hjerte","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU0OTE1YzgtMGQ1My00ZmNiLThkMWQtZTkwMmNiZmYyNjFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDYxOTY1Njg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three generations of a family coming together over a weekend. A sick mother's wish to die before her disease worsens gets harder to handle as old conflicts come to the surface.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3335048/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JvH48"},"dateCreated":"2016-07-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent situational plot around euthanasia, with ample complications and unexpected turns of events. Everyone's motives and reasoning are portrayed very well","reviewBody":"Saw this at the Noordelijk film festival 2015 in Leeuwarden (NL). It all starts with a small family gathering over the weekend, nothing out of the ordinary at first sight. Rather than getting into the usual annoyances and uneasy relationships common with family in law, or old bones to pick between brothers and sisters, the weekend starts unproblematic. Plans have been made previously for a do-it-yourself form of euthanasia, which is illegal almost everywhere. Yet we learn that everyone involved has accepted the procedure. The timing is such that the mother can take the pills by herself, without help, something not possible anymore when her illness worsens, the latter due in 1 or 2 months. Her husband can say that she did it all by herself while he took a walk, particularly important as a precaution because as a doctor he certainly cannot be suspected of any active involvement in such a procedure.

The group of relatives assembled for the weekend in question is well chosen, from a plot perspective, with very diverse characters and attitudes, albeit that there are not so many family members that we lose track on the respective opinions and motives. In spite of the a priori agreement on the whole process, we observe that some are getting cold feet and we see them wanting to postpone or even dismiss the whole procedure. Reasons for it vary but are certainly genuine and we can follow their trains of thought very well. These withdrawals happen with one after the other, each with different motives, and each eventually coming along and prepared to stick to the original plan. It sounds confusing but the script is well designed and the timing is perfect.

One example, to illustrate the sort of objections, is that one daughter regrets that she did not spend enough time with her mother in the past, having given more thought to her career and other priorities elsewhere. Now that she has more time on her hands, she welcomes the opportunity to renew the relationship with her mother, and to discuss matters of mutual interest. This is something that I can understand fully, as having similar ideas myself over having not spent sufficient time with my parents, in spite of them devoting ample time to me when I was young. A second argument of the daughter is that doctors can be wrong in their predictions, in other words that the planned euthanasia is much too soon, and that medicine can be invented in the meantime to prolong her life for many years to come. All this is just an example of aforementioned turns of events, everything just rational and understandable, yet endangering the plans that were so well thought through.

It is an achievement in itself that it all happened on screen within 97 minutes, in a limited time span in which not a second was wasted, letting events pass by in a logical order and evenly spread over time. Don't assume an overall gloomy atmosphere, since there is ample humor included in spite of the circumstances.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1752,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-11-13","keywords":"weekend,family relationships,euthanasia","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0639152/","name":"Ghita Nørby"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0824785/","name":"Paprika Steen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4439530/","name":"Danica Curcic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000806/","name":"Bille August"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0249327/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054911/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048411/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1311535/","name":"Christian Torpe"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

Three generations of a family coming together over a weekend. A sick mother's wish to die before her disease worsens gets harder to handle as old conflicts come to the surface." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3335048/","name":"Stille hjerte","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU0OTE1YzgtMGQ1My00ZmNiLThkMWQtZTkwMmNiZmYyNjFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDYxOTY1Njg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three generations of a family coming together over a weekend. A sick mother's wish to die before her disease worsens gets harder to handle as old conflicts come to the surface.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3335048/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"JvH48","dateCreated":"2016-07-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent situational plot around euthanasia, with ample complications and unexpected turns of events. Everyone's motives and reasoning are portrayed very well","reviewBody":"Saw this at the Noordelijk film festival 2015 in Leeuwarden (NL). It all starts with a small family gathering over the weekend, nothing out of the ordinary at first sight. Rather than getting into the usual annoyances and uneasy relationships common with family in law, or old bones to pick between brothers and sisters, the weekend starts unproblematic. Plans have been made previously for a do-it-yourself form of euthanasia, which is illegal almost everywhere. Yet we learn that everyone involved has accepted the procedure. The timing is such that the mother can take the pills by herself, without help, something not possible anymore when her illness worsens, the latter due in 1 or 2 months. Her husband can say that she did it all by herself while he took a walk, particularly important as a precaution because as a doctor he certainly cannot be suspected of any active involvement in such a procedure.

The group of relatives assembled for the weekend in question is well chosen, from a plot perspective, with very diverse characters and attitudes, albeit that there are not so many family members that we lose track on the respective opinions and motives. In spite of the a priori agreement on the whole process, we observe that some are getting cold feet and we see them wanting to postpone or even dismiss the whole procedure. Reasons for it vary but are certainly genuine and we can follow their trains of thought very well. These withdrawals happen with one after the other, each with different motives, and each eventually coming along and prepared to stick to the original plan. It sounds confusing but the script is well designed and the timing is perfect.

One example, to illustrate the sort of objections, is that one daughter regrets that she did not spend enough time with her mother in the past, having given more thought to her career and other priorities elsewhere. Now that she has more time on her hands, she welcomes the opportunity to renew the relationship with her mother, and to discuss matters of mutual interest. This is something that I can understand fully, as having similar ideas myself over having not spent sufficient time with my parents, in spite of them devoting ample time to me when I was young. A second argument of the daughter is that doctors can be wrong in their predictions, in other words that the planned euthanasia is much too soon, and that medicine can be invented in the meantime to prolong her life for many years to come. All this is just an example of aforementioned turns of events, everything just rational and understandable, yet endangering the plans that were so well thought through.

It is an achievement in itself that it all happened on screen within 97 minutes, in a limited time span in which not a second was wasted, letting events pass by in a logical order and evenly spread over time. Don't assume an overall gloomy atmosphere, since there is ample humor included in spite of the circumstances.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1752,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1,"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-11-13","keywords":"weekend,family relationships,euthanasia","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0639152/","name":"Ghita Nørby","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0824785/","name":"Paprika Steen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4439530/","name":"Danica Curcic"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000806/","name":"Bille August"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0249327/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054911/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048411/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1311535/","name":"Christian Torpe"],"duration":"PT1H37M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Danish Girl
Dziewczyna z portretu
The Danish Girl
programme.desc:
The Danish Girl: Directed by Tom Hooper. With Alicia Vikander, Eddie Redmayne, Tusse Silberg, Adrian Schiller. A fictitious love story loosely inspired by the lives of Danish artists Lili Elbe and Gerda Wegener. Lili and Gerda's marriage and work evolve as they navigate Lili's groundbreaking journey as a transgender pioneer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0810819/","name":"The Danish Girl","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0NjA4NjE2Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzIxNTY2NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A fictitious love story loosely inspired by the lives of Danish artists Lili Elbe and Gerda Wegener. Lili and Gerda's marriage and work evolve as they navigate Lili's groundbreaking journey as a transgender pioneer.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0810819/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bob-the-movie-man"},"dateCreated":"2016-01-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Vikander shines but overall it didn't connect with me as expected","reviewBody":"The new cinema year has got off to a robust start with the new movie from Tom Hooper ("The King's Speech", "Les Misérables"). 

We have seen many depictions of physical torture on the screen over the years, from the interminable teen-slasher pics, through 'that chair scene' in "Casino Royale" to the stylized presentations of Quentin Tarantino and Martin Scorsese in films like "Reservoir Dogs" and "Casino". "The Danish Girl" is also in its way a film about torture, but more akin to the mental torture seen in films like "Buried" or "Flightpath". What must it be like to be trapped with a sexual orientation that you feel is not your own? To possess physical body parts you don't believe you should have? And all in a time (the 1920's) when an exposed ankle was considered slightly daring.

Based on a true story, Oscar-winner Eddie Redmayne ("The Theory of Everything") and Alicia Vikander ("Ex Machina") play a bohemian married couple Einar and Gerda Wegener, apparently happily married and trying for a child in 1920's Copenhagen. Einar is a renowned landscape artist with his wife a struggling portrait artist living in his shadow. After taking part in a cross-dressing modelling session, strong feelings are awakened in Einar. As a bit of a 'game' Gerda encourages him to explore the character of his alter-ego "Lili" further: a big mistake, as Einar is swept into a spiral of confusion and self-doubt.

Eddie Redmayne is surely up for another Oscar-nomination for his brave performance as Einar/Lili, using his expressive eyes to great effect and delivering a truly heart-rending performance. With all this said however, I never quite believed I was watching the character of Lili but more Redmayne acting the character. Perhaps this is unfair, as Einar/Lili is such a bizarrely multi-dimensional person no one could perhaps have played him/her to my satisfaction. But I suspect (particularly as Redmayne won last year) this won't bring Redmayne the Oscar double. 

Far more impressive for me was the delicious and delightful Alicia Vikander, once more turning in a fantastic performance as the increasingly desperate (both psychologically and sexually) Gerda. With Rooney Mara, Vikander must be one of the brightest actress talents in today's cinema. 

Also turning in a strong performance, in what is a very limited cast list, is Matthias Schoenaerts ("Far from the Madding Crowd") as a Parisian art dealer with a link to Einar's past. The omni-present (sorry, that should read "hard-working") Ben Whishaw turns up again as a party guest with an unhealthy interest in Lili and Sebastian Koch (most recently seen in series 5 of "Homeland") plays Dr Warnekros who is a pioneer in the new and risky business of sexual reassignment surgery.

Another star of the film is the luscious Danish capital, filmed in vibrant colours, as if from the artists' palettes, by Danny Cohen, a Hooper favourite. Also a big surprise to me was the gloriously photographed Danish countryside, seen at the end of the film, with mountains and seascapes I never knew existed.

Another Hooper alumni, Alexandre Desplat, supplies the soupy but very fitting score.

While the film features a compelling story and much impressive acting, I never personally felt as connected to the story as I was to "The King's Speech". This isn't helped by a rather stagy script by Lucinda Coxon that feels lightweight at times. Perhaps its because we are in Oscar- season but, to me, it all felt a tad pretentious and (no pun intended) could have done with a few snips in places to reduce the running time by 15 minutes or so. That being said, and as an alternative view, I should point out that my wife was in tears for a good proportion of the film and disagrees vehemently with my views. I say "my wife", but since watching the film she's started wearing braces and smoking cigars – so I'm rather confused as to WHAT exactly is going on. :-)

(For the graphical version of this review, see bob-the-movie-man.com. Thanks).","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":175378,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2016-01-01","keywords":"transgender,gender identity,1920s,lgbtq,copenhagen denmark","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Online Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2595992089","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwNzY4NzMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODIyMjExNzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwNzY4NzMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODIyMjExNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Watch a new trailer for The Danish Girl."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1519666/","name":"Eddie Redmayne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2539953/","name":"Alicia Vikander"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1720028/","name":"Amber Heard"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0393799/","name":"Tom Hooper"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057311/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0551876/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0185309/","name":"Lucinda Coxon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2286442/","name":"David Ebershoff"}],"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Krawiec
programme.desc: Niklos (Dimitris Imellos) jest dorosłym mężczyzną, któremu nie powodzi się w życiu. Jego rodzinny warsztat krawiecki grozi bankructwem, a on sam może stracić dach nad głową, gdyż mieszka na strychu zakładu. Jednak widmo porażki finansowej mobilizuje go do działania. Niklos otwiera swój prywatny obwoźny zakład krawiecki. Na rowerze przemierza kolejne kilometry, zmienia całkiem swoje życie i po raz pierwszy się zakochuje. Sympatyczna opowieść o powolnym wkraczaniu w jesień życia.

programme.title: Intolerable Cruelty
Okrucieństwo nie do przyjęcia
Intolerable Cruelty
programme.desc: Intolerable Cruelty: Directed by Joel Coen, Ethan Coen. With George Clooney, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Geoffrey Rush, Cedric the Entertainer. A beautiful gold digger matches wits with a shrewd Beverly Hills divorce lawyer who is increasingly attracted to her." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0138524/","name":"Intolerable Cruelty","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2OTc5Mjc0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMDYyMjg3._V1_.jpg","description":"A beautiful gold digger matches wits with a shrewd Beverly Hills divorce lawyer who is increasingly attracted to her.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0138524/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"warnerclassic"},"dateCreated":"2004-10-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not intolerable, but","reviewBody":"George Clooney stars as a self-loving whiter than white toothed lawyer who is becoming bored with his never-ending success. A challenge comes in the shapely form of Marilyn Rexroth (Catherine Zeta Jones) who wants to marry (or preferably divorce) her way to riches. With Clooney hired to represent her soon to be ex husband, he inevitably falls for the gold diggers charms.\n\nDirected by the Coen brothers, a directorial team who have helmed oddball comedies such as 'Fargo' and 'O Brother, Where Art Thou?' this is the team's first branch in to a high profile Hollywood film. Clooney, as the sharp suited lawyer, is excellent. Like Cary Grant or David Niven, Clooney is able to mock himself without compensating his screen appeal. Catherine Zeta Jones as the money hungry Marilyn is as sexy as her character demands from the scripted page. However, despite the quick fire dialogue, Intolerable Cruelty is simply not as funny as it thinks, it's cynical message of love and money taking away the romantic push it needs to place it in the league of the Tracy/Hepburn films the movie aspires to. Clooney's character also suffers from an over enthusiastic plot that later drives his character to attempt to commit a crime that totally contradicts the audiences perception of him. A battle of the sexes comedy that has sex appeal but no romance, Intolerable Cruelty is a film that reaches for the golden age of Hollywood but only touches the bronze."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":95179,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Romance"],"datePublished":"2003-12-24","keywords":"woman wears eyeglasses,strong female character,lake tahoe,reference to henry viii,deception","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Intolerable Cruelty","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi781320473","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmYzNTk4NGUtZDQ5My00MDEzLTlkZGMtNDU3MzE3MDQ0ZmI2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmYzNTk4NGUtZDQ5My00MDEzLTlkZGMtNDU3MzE3MDQ0ZmI2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001876/","name":"Catherine Zeta-Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000671/","name":"Billy Bob Thornton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001054/","name":"Joel Coen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001053/","name":"Ethan Coen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049706/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0709070/","name":"Robert Ramsey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0832043/","name":"Matthew Stone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0738908/","name":"John Romano"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

A beautiful gold digger matches wits with a shrewd Beverly Hills divorce lawyer who is increasingly attracted to her." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0138524/","name":"Intolerable Cruelty","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2OTc5Mjc0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMDYyMjg3._V1_.jpg","description":"A beautiful gold digger matches wits with a shrewd Beverly Hills divorce lawyer who is increasingly attracted to her.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0138524/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"warnerclassic","dateCreated":"2004-10-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not intolerable, but","reviewBody":"George Clooney stars as a self-loving whiter than white toothed lawyer who is becoming bored with his never-ending success. A challenge comes in the shapely form of Marilyn Rexroth (Catherine Zeta Jones) who wants to marry (or preferably divorce) her way to riches. With Clooney hired to represent her soon to be ex husband, he inevitably falls for the gold diggers charms.\n\nDirected by the Coen brothers, a directorial team who have helmed oddball comedies such as 'Fargo' and 'O Brother, Where Art Thou?' this is the team's first branch in to a high profile Hollywood film. Clooney, as the sharp suited lawyer, is excellent. Like Cary Grant or David Niven, Clooney is able to mock himself without compensating his screen appeal. Catherine Zeta Jones as the money hungry Marilyn is as sexy as her character demands from the scripted page. However, despite the quick fire dialogue, Intolerable Cruelty is simply not as funny as it thinks, it's cynical message of love and money taking away the romantic push it needs to place it in the league of the Tracy/Hepburn films the movie aspires to. Clooney's character also suffers from an over enthusiastic plot that later drives his character to attempt to commit a crime that totally contradicts the audiences perception of him. A battle of the sexes comedy that has sex appeal but no romance, Intolerable Cruelty is a film that reaches for the golden age of Hollywood but only touches the bronze.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":95179,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Romance"],"datePublished":"2003-12-24","keywords":"woman wears eyeglasses,strong female character,lake tahoe,reference to henry viii,deception","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Intolerable Cruelty","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi781320473","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmYzNTk4NGUtZDQ5My00MDEzLTlkZGMtNDU3MzE3MDQ0ZmI2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmYzNTk4NGUtZDQ5My00MDEzLTlkZGMtNDU3MzE3MDQ0ZmI2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Pictures","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001876/","name":"Catherine Zeta-Jones","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000671/","name":"Billy Bob Thornton"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001054/","name":"Joel Coen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001053/","name":"Ethan Coen"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049706/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0709070/","name":"Robert Ramsey","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0832043/","name":"Matthew Stone","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0738908/","name":"John Romano"],"duration":"PT1H40M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Danish Girl
Dziewczyna z portretu
The Danish Girl
programme.desc:
The Danish Girl: Directed by Tom Hooper. With Alicia Vikander, Eddie Redmayne, Tusse Silberg, Adrian Schiller. A fictitious love story loosely inspired by the lives of Danish artists Lili Elbe and Gerda Wegener. Lili and Gerda's marriage and work evolve as they navigate Lili's groundbreaking journey as a transgender pioneer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0810819/","name":"The Danish Girl","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0NjA4NjE2Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzIxNTY2NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A fictitious love story loosely inspired by the lives of Danish artists Lili Elbe and Gerda Wegener. Lili and Gerda's marriage and work evolve as they navigate Lili's groundbreaking journey as a transgender pioneer.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0810819/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bob-the-movie-man"},"dateCreated":"2016-01-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Vikander shines but overall it didn't connect with me as expected","reviewBody":"The new cinema year has got off to a robust start with the new movie from Tom Hooper ("The King's Speech", "Les Misérables"). 

We have seen many depictions of physical torture on the screen over the years, from the interminable teen-slasher pics, through 'that chair scene' in "Casino Royale" to the stylized presentations of Quentin Tarantino and Martin Scorsese in films like "Reservoir Dogs" and "Casino". "The Danish Girl" is also in its way a film about torture, but more akin to the mental torture seen in films like "Buried" or "Flightpath". What must it be like to be trapped with a sexual orientation that you feel is not your own? To possess physical body parts you don't believe you should have? And all in a time (the 1920's) when an exposed ankle was considered slightly daring.

Based on a true story, Oscar-winner Eddie Redmayne ("The Theory of Everything") and Alicia Vikander ("Ex Machina") play a bohemian married couple Einar and Gerda Wegener, apparently happily married and trying for a child in 1920's Copenhagen. Einar is a renowned landscape artist with his wife a struggling portrait artist living in his shadow. After taking part in a cross-dressing modelling session, strong feelings are awakened in Einar. As a bit of a 'game' Gerda encourages him to explore the character of his alter-ego "Lili" further: a big mistake, as Einar is swept into a spiral of confusion and self-doubt.

Eddie Redmayne is surely up for another Oscar-nomination for his brave performance as Einar/Lili, using his expressive eyes to great effect and delivering a truly heart-rending performance. With all this said however, I never quite believed I was watching the character of Lili but more Redmayne acting the character. Perhaps this is unfair, as Einar/Lili is such a bizarrely multi-dimensional person no one could perhaps have played him/her to my satisfaction. But I suspect (particularly as Redmayne won last year) this won't bring Redmayne the Oscar double. 

Far more impressive for me was the delicious and delightful Alicia Vikander, once more turning in a fantastic performance as the increasingly desperate (both psychologically and sexually) Gerda. With Rooney Mara, Vikander must be one of the brightest actress talents in today's cinema. 

Also turning in a strong performance, in what is a very limited cast list, is Matthias Schoenaerts ("Far from the Madding Crowd") as a Parisian art dealer with a link to Einar's past. The omni-present (sorry, that should read "hard-working") Ben Whishaw turns up again as a party guest with an unhealthy interest in Lili and Sebastian Koch (most recently seen in series 5 of "Homeland") plays Dr Warnekros who is a pioneer in the new and risky business of sexual reassignment surgery.

Another star of the film is the luscious Danish capital, filmed in vibrant colours, as if from the artists' palettes, by Danny Cohen, a Hooper favourite. Also a big surprise to me was the gloriously photographed Danish countryside, seen at the end of the film, with mountains and seascapes I never knew existed.

Another Hooper alumni, Alexandre Desplat, supplies the soupy but very fitting score.

While the film features a compelling story and much impressive acting, I never personally felt as connected to the story as I was to "The King's Speech". This isn't helped by a rather stagy script by Lucinda Coxon that feels lightweight at times. Perhaps its because we are in Oscar- season but, to me, it all felt a tad pretentious and (no pun intended) could have done with a few snips in places to reduce the running time by 15 minutes or so. That being said, and as an alternative view, I should point out that my wife was in tears for a good proportion of the film and disagrees vehemently with my views. I say "my wife", but since watching the film she's started wearing braces and smoking cigars – so I'm rather confused as to WHAT exactly is going on. :-)

(For the graphical version of this review, see bob-the-movie-man.com. Thanks).","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":175378,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2016-01-01","keywords":"transgender,gender identity,1920s,lgbtq,copenhagen denmark","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Online Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2595992089","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwNzY4NzMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODIyMjExNzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwNzY4NzMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODIyMjExNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Watch a new trailer for The Danish Girl."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1519666/","name":"Eddie Redmayne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2539953/","name":"Alicia Vikander"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1720028/","name":"Amber Heard"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0393799/","name":"Tom Hooper"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057311/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0551876/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0185309/","name":"Lucinda Coxon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2286442/","name":"David Ebershoff"}],"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="
